loans.name: Aed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is thirty-eight years old, married, and has two children.

Aed has owned an electric generator since 2009, leasing electricity lines in his area and the surroundings. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3,000 to repair the engine of the generator. His objective is to get more profit so he can provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To repair the generator's engine.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque quiere garantizar el terreno para el cultivo, por eso con estos fondos pagara el alquiler del terreno para el cultivo de maíz y frijol que está por iniciar.
El tuvo una experiencia positiva con el préstamo anterior ya que compro los insumos necesarios para que la siembra se desarrollara y diera abundante frutos, mejorando tambien las condiciones de la familia.
texts.en:
Marcelino is requesting a new loan to guarantee availability of cropland.  He will use the funds to rent land for the upcoming sowing season for his corn and bean crops.

He had a positive experience with the previous loan which he used to buy the supplies he needed for an abundant crop, which improved his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for land rental.

loans.name: Walter  Simon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO A”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Walter Simon; el tiene 55 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesor del  nivel primario, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño del socio es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar. El  socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal para pagar los estudios de su hijo.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "VALLE SAGRADO A", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Walter Simon, 55, has a common-law wife and a son.  He alternates his daily activities with his job as an elementary school teacher.  He works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and through his job is able to provide for his son who he wants to see get a good education.  The loan he is requesting is to pay for his son's tuition.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To pay for his son's tuition.

loans.name: Maria Lita

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su familia, su madre y dos hijos quienes dependen de ella, es madre soltera, ella ha realizado esta actividad dese hace muchos años, como un medio para mantenerse ocupada y al mismo tiempo generar ingresos, lo heredo de su madre, a veces tiene ciertas dificultades por los precios que varían constantemente. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dos cerdos, y compra de concentrado para alimentarlos, esta compra le ayudara a poseer más cerditos para la granja y mejorar las posibilidades de generar ingresos para su familia.
La aspiración de María es ampliar su granja, darse a conocer en el mercado para encontrar más clientes, además de velar por el desarrollo y estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María raises pigs and lives with her family, comprised of her mother and two children who depend on her.  She is a single mother and has been in this business for several years.  She learned the trade from her mother and is able to generate an income and stay busy this way.  Sometimes she has problems with the prices that fluctuate constantly.

She is requesting a loan to buy two pigs and animal feed concentrate.  This will allow her to have more pigs on her farm, which will help generate more income for her family.

Maria's goal is to expand her farm, become more well known and reach more customers, while also watching out for her children's development and education.

loans.use: To buy two pigs and animal feed concentrate.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO A”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesora del nivel secundario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, yeso y clavos. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "VALLE SAGRADO A", which is in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Elizabeth, 54, is married and has a son.  She alternates her daily activities with her job as a high school teacher.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. and through her job has been able to support her son.  Her dream is to build her own house.  She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, plaster and nails.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, sand, plaster and nails.

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Milagros lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Margarita del Carmen quien vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 8 años, negocio que inicio con unos cuantos productos. Ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 23, 22, 20, 17 y 13 años quienes le ayudan en el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Bertha quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 3 años y Meyling quien vende bisutería y ropa.
texts.en:
The 'Milagro' (Miracle) group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of these people is Margarita del Carmen who has been selling clothing and cosmetics for eight years.  She started her business with only a few products.  Margarita del Carmen is married and has five children who are 23, 22, 20, 17 and 13 years old.  They help her in the business.

The other members of the group are Bertha, who has been selling clothing for three years, and Meyling who sells costume jewelry and clothing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shirts, pants, swimsuits, etc.)

loans.name: Maria  Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO A”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Antonieta; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de artesanía, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite y también la socia vende artesanía como chompas,polos,gosrros y guantes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar los negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chompas, gorros, guantes y chalinas y también para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas al por mayor.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta is a member of the 'Valle Sagrado A' (Sacred Valley A) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Maria Antonieta is 37 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities, her grocery store business and her business selling handicrafts.  She sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, milk and oil, as well as handicrafts such as sweaters, polo shirts, caps and gloves.  She works from 8.00am to 5.00pm and, through her businesses, she provides for her children.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business and her handicrafts business.  She is requesting this loan to buy sweaters, caps, gloves and scarves, and to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies wholesale.

The borrower is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, caps, gloves and scarves, and to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies wholesale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, originario de Chacaraseca comarca de León, de oficio agricultor y comerciante, casado, padre de un hijo de 22 años el cual esta estudiando. El empezó con la actividad  como comerciante cuando tenía 25 años de edad cuando viajaba de Managua a León para vender ropa , se levantaba desde muy temprana horas para tomar el primer bus que lo llevara hasta la ciudad capital Managua comprar mercadería ´para vender en León poco a poco fue ganando clientes y conociendo lugares donde conseguir comprar más barato y poder hacer más clientes, con las ganancias logro poner una pequeña y sencilla pulpería que la administra su esposa  aunque nunca dejando atrás su actividad en la agricultura por medio de estas dos actividades es que ha mantenido a su familia. El utilizara el crédito para comprar granos básicos, productos de limpieza, avenas, sopas, pan, enlatados y también comprar semillas, fertilizantes para sus siembras de hortalizas. El desea ir aumentando poco a poco su pulpería con productos variados y de mucha necesidad para su comunidad y sacar adelante sus cultivos para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Francisco is from Chacaraseca, in León.  He is a farmer and a shopkeeper.  Francisco is married, and has one 22-year-old son who is studying.  He started  selling products when he was 25 years old and used to travel from Managua to León to sell clothing.  He would get up very early and take the first bus to the city of Managua where he would buy merchandise to sell in León.  He gradually acquired customers and got to know where he could obtain his merchandise more cheaply and how he could attract more customers.  He managed to use his profits to set up a small, humble grocery store which his wife runs though he doesn't neglect his farming work.  Through his two businesses, he has supported his family.  Francisco will use his loan to buy basic grains, cleaning products, oats, soups, bread and canned food.  He will also buy seeds and fertilizers for his vegetable crops.  He would like to gradually expand his grocery store with a variety of products that people in his community really need.  He would also like to make progress in his farming so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cleaning products, oats, soups, bread and canned food, and to buy seeds and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 29 years old, married, and has four children. Haydar has owned a store since 1998, selling all types of grains. He has sufficient experience and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by. He is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent and to make a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent and to make a sliding door.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 26 years old, married, and who has two children. Amir is a barber. In 2004 he opened his own shop, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has sufficient experience and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by. He is requesting a $2,500 loan to redecorate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is married with four children. All of them are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 2 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

In the picture, fellow borrowers were looking when they were taking Jean Bosco's picture. All these borrowers are rice farmers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji is a 34-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 12 and 4. All of them go to school. 

Keji runs a food store business, and she has been in the business for 6 years. She has no employees. Keji heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and through outreach and promotion done by the loans officers. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more food items like tomatoes, eggs, onions, oranges and many others. Keji has no other source of income in addition to this business.

In 5 years time, Keji would like to hope for increments in the size of her business. Her major challenges include low income at the moment, issues of school fees and home expenses. She says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, and that it is highly received in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like tomatoes, eggs, onions, oranges and many others.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 12. All of them are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 1 year. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and to renovate his house. Behind him in the picture, fellow agriculture borrowers were looking on.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Tineere Group

texts.fr:
Mme CLEMENTINE est la représentante du groupe TINEERE. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 04ans le moins âgé a 02ans. Personne ne  va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes à sa charge.

Mme est restauratrice (vend du riz). Elle exerce ce métier depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de Toecin. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter un sac d’arachide pour transformer en patte d’arachide  pour la préparation de la sauce du riz.

Elle  utilise ses bénéfices pour s’occuper de sa famille. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir un restaurant.
texts.en:
Clementine is the representative of the Tineere group. She is married and mother to two children. The eldest child is four years old and the youngest two. Neither of them attend school and Clementine has two other dependents.

Clementine is a restaurateur, selling rice. She has been carrying out this profession for the past three years and gets her supplies at the market in Toecin. Her customers are both women and men.

Clementine would like to buy a sack of groundnuts to make into groundnut paste for the preparation of sauce for rice. 

She uses her profits to look after her family and her ambition is to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a sack of groundnuts to make up into groundnut paste for the preparation of a sauce for rice

loans.name: Ambe

texts.en:
Ambe is single with four children, and lives with them in a two-room house at mile two Nkwen, a quarter in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced challenges in life, such as her children's sickness for which she was unable to provide medication, the death of her sister and the death of two of her brothers in the same month. This caused her to be more frustrated because they were very supportive of her. Above all, the downfall of her business due to armed robbery further worsened her condition.

She joined GHAPE in 2003 and owns an off-license in mile two Nkwen where she also sells cooked food. She says that with the new loan she will buy bottles, crates and drinks to expand her business, and in addition she will buy food items like coco-yam (edible taro root) and banana that will enable her to run her restaurant. She is positive her business will succeed because of the longevity of the business in a good business site, and because she has regular customers who are ready to buy from her. The community will benefit from the supply of drinks on occasions like wedding ceremonies, as well as death celebrations, which are more frequent in her community.

She says with the profit from the loan she will educate her children, provide for medication and also plow back part of the profit. She says she prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient payment intervals and education before loan disbursement.

loans.use: To purchase coco-yams, bananas, meat, crates, bottles and drinks.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 9 years. All of them are enrolled in school. He has been a rice farmer for one and a half years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. Behind Vincent in the picture, fellow borrowers are standing and looking on.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 15 years. All of them attend school.  He has been a rice farmer for 1 year. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and to pay school fees for the children. In the picture, some fellow agriculture borrowers were behind Gaspard during the photo shoot.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Mutemi

texts.en:
Mutemi is a 31-year-old restaurant owner in Mombasa. He is married. He has been operating the restaurant for the past two years with great success.
 
This is his first business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to renovate his restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables. 

He will use the anticipated profits to open another restaurant. He hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to renovate his restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly is a 22-year-old salon owner in Mombasa. She is a married mother of one. She has been running her business for the past five years successfully.

This marks her first loan from KADET to finance her business. Emily plans to purchase new blow dryers, hair tongs and hair rollers for her salon. 

Emily will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and purchase a piece of land on which to construct rental houses. She hopes to develop a bigger and more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase new blow dryers, hair tongs and hair rollers for her salon.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is married with two children, ages 3 and 6, both of whom are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. 

Jean Bosco has been a rice farmer for two years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output. Behind him, in the picture, there are a few agricultural workers pictured.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima lives in Kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in this business for two years. She is 40 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Saima heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan with BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kator. She sells tea and coffee, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan with BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase coffee and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Gervais

texts.en:
Gervais is married with six children, between ages 10 and 25. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for nine years. 

Gervais would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and pay the school fees for his children. In the picture, other agricultural borrowers are seated behind Gervais.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, a 61-year-old married mother of nine children ranging in age from 22 years to 40, describes herself as a visionary, aggressive and determined woman. For the past year she has operated a grocery store selling vegetables such as kale. Her business is located in a viable residential area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

Gladys will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables, and her business goal is to run a bigger grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business and employed people.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as kale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty, a 38-year-old married mother of four children, all in school, lives in Kator where she has been selling fish for three years. Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and is now requesting her first loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use the extra income arising from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is married and has a two-month-old baby. His wife works as a farmer. 

He has been a rice farmer for nine years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and support labor.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is married and has eight children between 4 and 18. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. 

He has been a rice farmer for three years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to hire support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output and pay school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds, and support labor.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old and married. 

He is a clothes dealer in Mombasa. He has been selling clothes for the past three years with success.

This marks his first business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers. 

He will use the anticipated profits to open another clothes shop and repay his loan. He hopes to excel in the business and in life.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is married and has a 1-year-old child. His wife works as a farmer. 

He has been a rice farmer for one year. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and support labor.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is married and has two children, 8 and 11 years old. Both are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. 

He has been a rice farmer for three years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output and buy a cow to provide milk for the family.

Behind Silas in the picture are other fellow rice farmers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds, and support labor.

loans.name: Vivianne

texts.en:
Vivianne is married and has three children between 10 and 18. All are enrolled in school. Her husband is a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for two years. 

She would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, Vivianne plans to expand the area she has been farming to get more output and pay school fees for the children. In the picture, her fellow rice farmers are sitting behind.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and labor costs.

loans.name: Theresie

texts.en:
Theresie is married. Her husband works as a farmer. She has been a rice farmer for three years. 

Theresie is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds and cover labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get an increased output and earn more income.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and labor cost support.

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre is married and has three children aged between the ages of 4 and 7. He has been a rice farmer for 11 years. 

Andre is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy fertilizers and seeds and hire labor in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get an increased output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and labor costs support.

loans.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mi Banquito lo conforman cinco personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Luisa quien tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace 4 años. El negocio lo inicio con la venta de ropa usada y poco a poco fue creciendo e invirtió en otros productos. Ella tiene tres hijos de 12, 10, 7 años quienes le ayudan en el negocio.

Las otras integrantes son Concepcion quien vende ropa, cosméticos y sandalias de manera ambulante, Vilma vende hielo, nacatamales y helados, Rosa tiene una pulpería y María Auxiliadora ropa de cama para niños y adultos…etc.
texts.en:
Mi Banquito Group (my little bank) is made up of five hard-working and enterprising people. One of them is María Luisa who has owned a grocery store for the past four years. In the beginning she sold used clothing and gradually she added other products to her inventory. Her three children (aged 12, 10 and 7) help her in the business. The other members of the group are:
  • Concepción is a street vendor who sells clothes, cosmetics and sandals,
  • Vilma sells ice, tamales and ice cream,
  • Rosa has a grocery store, and
  • María Auxiliadora sells bed linen for children and adults, etc.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 45-year-old business lady in Kongowea, Mombasa. She is married. 

She sells scratch cards, which provide air time for making phone calls, a business she has been doing for the past four years with great success.
 
This marks her first loan term with KADET  Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to add more stock of scratch cards. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her business further. She hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business.

loans.use: to add more stock of scratch cards.

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en:
Ildephonse is married and has three children between 3 and 7. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. 

He has been a rice farmer for one year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output. He plans to establish a ranch in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and support labor.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is married and has one child who is currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a farmer. 

She has been a rice farmer for a period of one year. She would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been farming to get more output. 

Behind her in the picture, there are other agriculture borrowers seated while waiting for the cameraman.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain unde served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers. Jeanne is married with one child who is currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a farmer. She has been a rice farmer for a period of 1 year. She would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area he has been using to get more out put.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and support labor.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 39 years old and married to Pauline. They are blessed with two children. 

He has run a retail shop in Nakuru town for the past year. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of the clients, and he plans to use this loan to buy more stock of rice, washing detergent and wheat flour for sale.

In the future, Godfrey hopes to own a wholesales shop and a supermarket and make more income, thus improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy rice, washing detergent and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 51 years old. She runs a little shop where she makes and sells fast food. Narine works hard to keep the high quality of the food and services she offers, and due to this she has made the shop competitive among other fast food shops around. 

Narine has applied for this loan to increase her variety of services. She plans to purchase a piece of special equipment to make chicken, as well as a machine for making ice cream. This will help Narine to develop her business by increasing sales and earning more income. This business is vital for Narine to improve her household conditions and also to support her brother's family, who live apart.

loans.use: buy equipment to make food

loans.name: Flor Idalma

texts.es:
Flor Idalma tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de motorista, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad, vive en la aldea buenos aires, Tela, Atlántida.
La actividad que le genera ingresos a Flor en un negocio que tiene hace 2 años que es venta de producto Bogue y joyas de fantasía fina. Inicio este negocio con el propósito de aportar otro ingreso extra al hogar. La motivo dedicarse a este negocio porque ella trabajaba con la l cuñada vendiendo este producto el cual vio que era rentable y decidió entonces poner su propio negocio. Ella vende su producto por encargo y ofrece (Cremas, Lociones, artículos para el hogar) (collares, pulseras, aritos de fantasía fina). Ella se dedica a ofrecer su producto en las comunidades vecinas saliendo a trabajar desde las 8.00 am hasta las 5.00 pm.
Ella ha solicitado un préstamo con ODEF de 9,000 lempiras para comprar Joyas de fantasía fina y productos Vogue, para así poder suplir la demanda que tiene de producto. Con esta inversión espera obtener mas ingresos y dar mejor servicio a los cliente.
Su meta es seguir adelante para que su negocio crezca y así poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Idalma, age 26, is in a common-law marriage.  Her husband works as a driver.  She has two children, ages six and one.  She lives in the Buenos Aires village in Tela, Atlántida.

Flor has had a business that generates income for her for two years.  She sells Vogue cosmetics and jewelry.  She started this business with the intention of contributing an extra income to the household.  The reason she is in this business is because she worked with her sister-in-law selling this product.  

She saw that it was profitable, and she decided to establish her own business.  She sells her product by order.  She sells creams, lotions, household items, necklaces, bracelets, and earrings.  She sells her product in the neighboring communities.  She leaves for work at 8:00 a.m., and she works until 5:00 p.m. 

She has requested a loan for 9,000 lempiras from ODEF.  She will use it to buy jewelry and Voque products. This way she will be able to meet the product demand that she has.  With this investment she hopes to be able to get more income and give her customers better service.

Her goal is to get ahead and for her business to grow.  This way she will be able to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelery and Vogue products.

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe Sanchez Valladares

texts.es:
Rosa Guadalupe tiene 67 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 15 años de edad los cuales estudian, vive con su familia en la Colonia Evita San Francisco de Yojoa, Peña Blanca.
Doña Guadalupe es una maestra jubilada la cual hace 4 años  emprendió  un negocio de venta de novedades y  recargas de celulares.  Ella estableció este negocio en su casa en el cual manifiesta que le esta yendo muy bien. Ofrece a sus clientes Productos de Belleza, Ropa, Perfumes y adicional vende útiles Escolares. Doña Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora pues esta muy motivada desde que se dedica a su propio negocio en el cual genera sus propios ingresos para ayuda r en su hogar con los gastos que a diario se presentan. Además de dedicarse a esta actividad de vender estos productos, realiza también trabajos de costura. Dedica todo el día a su negocio.
En al actualidad solicito su Segundo préstamo de 22,000 lempiras los cuales invertirá en comprar mas productos de novedades, como productos de belleza para surtir mas su negocio y poder ofrecer variedad de producto a los clientes e incrementar su inventario. 
Su meta es ampliar mas su negocio, mantenerlo siempre surtido y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa Guadalupe, age 67, is married and has three children, ages 19, 17, and 15.  The children go to school.  She lives with her family in the Evita San Francisco neighborhood in Yojoa, Peña Blanca.

Guadalupe is a retired teacher.  Four years ago she undertook a business of selling novelty items and electronic loads for cell phones.  She established this business in her house, and she states that it is going very well for her.

She sells beauty products, clothes, perfumes, and school supplies.  Guadalupe is a very hard-working woman.  She has been very motivated ever since she started her own business.  She generates her own income with her business, and she uses the income to help with the daily household expenses.  In addition to this business activity of selling these products, she also does sewing jobs.  She devotes all day to her business.

She is currently requesting her second loan for 22,000 lempiras to buy novelty items and beauty products.  She will do this to stock her business more, to increase her inventory, and to be able to offer a variety of products to her customers.  Her goal is to expand her business, to keep it stocked always, and to get improved income.

loans.use: to buy novelty items, beauty products and electronic loads for cell phones.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has two children who attend school. She has been a rice farmer for seven years. 

Christine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get an increased output and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and labor cost support.

loans.name: David Peter H.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, is very pleased to present this group of primary teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 16,950,000.00 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 	

David is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 65 years old, married, and has six children, who attend primary, secondary, and tertiary institutions. He was born in Moyamba. He has been a teacher for 42 years. He is requesting a loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He has big responsibilities for his family, especially his nephew. He has been working at providing legal documentation services and has many customers visiting him to smooth their official document preparation since the year 2000. In parallel, he has owned a network since 2011. Today he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his nephew’s university fees until graduation. He will be more than happy to see him achieve a higher educational level. In the future, he plans to focus on one job and better support his family.

loans.use: to pay his nephew’s university fees

loans.name: Letty Rufina Sanchez Lascano

texts.es:
Letty es una mujer de 47 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida y ropa. 
Su historia empezó vendiendo comida con su hermano luego se independizaba y vende comida desde su casa adicional se dedicaba a vender ropas y solicito crédito para su negocio y otro parte para su negocio. En la actulidad su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener mi casa terminada o lujosa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comida y asi comprar pollos, aliños, bebidas.
texts.en:
Letty is a 47 year old woman who has many aspirations to succeed in her sales of food and clothing in the coming years. Her story selling food began with her brother and then she became independent and now sells food from her house. In addition she sold clothing and applied for a loan for one business and also for the other.

Currently Letty works alone and faces no difficulties. She is married with children and her most important dream is to have a house that is completed and luxurious. She would like a loan for her food sales and to purchase chickens, seasoning and drinks

loans.use: to buy chickens, seasoning and drinks.

loans.name: Khadime

texts.fr:
Khadime pratique le mareyage depuis près de 16 ans. Il achète toute la production de poisson d'une ou de deux pirogues au débarquement et la revend à des détaillants installées dans les grandes villes de l'intérieur du pays.Il pratique également l'agriculture afin de diversifier ses sources de revenus.Il est marié à deux épouses et est père de 6 enfants qui vont tous à l'école française et arabe. Khadim souffre toutefois de la rareté du poisson dans sa ville. il est ainsi obligé de voyager le long de la grande côte pour se procurer le produit; ce qui demande des sommes importantes. C'est pourquoi il sollicite un prêt de 500000f pour acheter 600 kg de poisson.
 Son ambition est d'acquérir ses propres pirogues et un véhicules frigorifique pour mieux écouler la production.
texts.en:
Khadime has been in the fish trade for nearly 16 years. He buys the whole catch from 1 or 2 canoes when they unload their fish, and resells it to retailers located in the large towns of the country's interior. Khadime also farms, in order to diversify his sources of revenue. He is married to 2 women and father to 6 children, who all go to the French-Arab school.

Khadime's town is, however, suffering from a shortage of fish. He is therefore forced to travel along the extensive coastline to obtain the product, something which requires important sums of money. This is why he is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to buy 600 kg of fish. His ambition is to buy his own canoes and a refrigerated vehicle so that he can better move and sell his goods.

loans.use: to buy 600 kg of fish.

loans.name: Celsa Eveling

texts.es:
Celsa, de 35 años de edad, casada madre de un hijo 8 años de edad. Estudio una carrera técnica de contabilidad, pero ella desde siempre le ha gustado todo lo relacionado con las plantas y la naturaleza por tal motivo puso su negocio de Vivero forestal y plantas ornamentales  su esposo y su padre la han apoyado desde el principio lleva 4 años con este negocio además de esto también vende ropa para conseguir otros ingresos y aportar en su hogar. Esta actividad la realiza en su comunidad en las afueras de León. 

Quiere utilizar el crédito para comprar plantas , semillas de diferentes tipos de plantas . Con el objetivo de ofrecer una mejor variedad en sus plantas y flores. Pues su idea es expandir a mas de un vivero en su comunidad para promover el cuido y protección al medio ambiente y al mismo tiempo generar ingresos para las  familias.
texts.en:
Celsa, age 35, is married and has an eight year old son.  She studied the career of accounting.  However, she has always liked everything related to plants and nature.  For that reason she set up her business of a forest nursery and ornamental plants.  Her husband and her father have supported her since the beginning.  She has been in this business for four years.  She also sells clothes in order to get extra income and contribute to her household.  She conducts her business activity in her community on the outskirts of León.

She wants to use the loan to buy plants and seeds for different types of plants.  Her objective is to offer a better variety of plants and flowers.  Her idea is to expand to become more than a nursery in her community.  She wants to promote the care and protection of the environment while, at the same time, generating income for the families.

loans.use: to buy plants and seeds for different types of plants.

loans.name: Luz  Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO A”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 70 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende leche, azúcar, aceite, galletas y arroz, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas al por mayor.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Valle Sagrado A" [sacred valley A] communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

This member is Luz Marina. She is 70 years old and is a widow with two children. She alternates her everyday activities with her business, which is a grocery store. She sells milk, sugar, oil, cookies and rice. Luz Marina works from 6am until 10pm. Through this business she is able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. Luz Marina is requesting this loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies wholesale.

Luz Marina is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying her installments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 38 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller de costura su historia empezó desde pequeña le lleno la atención la costura entonces decidió ser costurera, el trabajo lo hago sola, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, si tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es seguir creciendo en su taller. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su taller de costura comprando textiles, hilos, telas para su negocio.
texts.en: Rosa is a 38 year old woman and has many aspirations for the coming years of prospering with her sewing workshop. Her story began since from a young age sewing caught her attention, she decided to be a seamstress. She does the work alone and does not have difficulties. She is not married, and has children. Her biggest dream is to continue growing her workshop. For that she would like a loan for her sewing workshop buying textiles, thread and fabric for her business.

loans.use: to acquire supplies such as textiles, thread, and fabric.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Komlan est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est célibataire.
Komlan travaille comme revendeur de produits de quincaillerie depuis 2010. Il vend ses marchandises dans une boutique et s’approvisionne  à Lomé. 
Komlan a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des peintures, et grillages. Il veut réinvestir dans son activité afin de mieux préparer sa vie maritale.
texts.en:
Komlan is 28 years old and single.
He has been reselling hardware goods since 2010.  He stocks up in Lomé and sells in a shop.
Komlan has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy paints and metal fences.  He wants to reinvest in his activity in order to better prepare for married life.

loans.use: to buy hardware goods.

loans.name: Icyerekezo / Gshsh Group

texts.fr:
Léonard fait partie du groupe Icyerekezo/Gshsh. Il a 36 ans et il est marié, avec 4 enfants de 8 ans à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Léonard est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilise des semences de race améliore et utilise des engrais chimique. Dans les prochaines années, Léonard voudrait avoir un stock de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Léonard is a member of the Icyerekezo/Gshsh group. He is 36 years old, married and has 4 children, aged between 8 and 16, who all go to school. He himself has 6 years of primary school education and is a farmer.

This is Léonard's first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to buy fertilizer and to pay his manual labourers. His strategy for the growth of his business involves using improved breed seeds and chemical fertilizers. In the coming years, he would like to have a stockpile of rice. He plans to use his profits to pay his children's educational expenses and to take care of them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay his labourers.

loans.name: Abadasigana/cyrkr Group

texts.fr:
Jérôme fait partie du groupe Abadasigana Cyarukara. Il a 32 ans et il est marié, avec 1 enfant de 7 mois. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jérôme est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des houes, des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilise des semences de race améliore. Dans les prochaines années, Jérôme voudrait être un grand agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jérôme is a member of the Abadasigana Cyarukara group. He is 32 years old and married, and has a 7-month-old infant. Jérôme has 6 years of primary school education and is a farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy some hoes and fertilizer, and to pay his manual labourers.

Jérôme's strategy for the growth of his business involves using improved breed seeds. In the coming years, he would like to become a large farmer in his region. He plans to use his profits to improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy hoes and fertilizer, and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es: María es una mujer de 70 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida su historia empezó cuando fue independiente por sus hijos siempre se desempeña vendiendo comida desayunos y almuerzos, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son los ladrones, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es adecuar su negocio en su local. Por eso quiere el préstamo para mejorar infraestructura del local, comprando cemento, arena, bloques e insumos y viveres para la comida que vende.
texts.en:
Maria is a 70 year old woman who has many aspirations to succeed in her food sales in the coming years. Her story began when her children became independent. She is always selling breakfasts and lunches. She works alone and has problems with thieves.

Maria is a single mother and has sons. Her most important dream is to make her business premises suitable. Consequently she would like a loan to improve the infrastructure of the space by buying cement, sand and blocks and to buy supplies and food for the meals she sells.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the premises by buying cement, sand and blocks and to buy food supplies.

loans.name: David Jose

texts.es:
Aparicio es un hombre de 37 años que edad, padre de 2 niños a los cuales ama mucho. Actualmente el vive en la ciudad de Nazca, lugar visitado por muchos turistas debido a las inmensas líneas trazadas en los suelos y también por la calidez y servicio de su gente.

Aparicio se dedica a brindar servicio turístico en toda la ciudad de Nazca, el labora en esta actividad un promedio de 8 horas diarias y atiende a 8 personas aproximadamente, debido a que sus turistas no solo son del exterior si no también nacionales. Él sabe que estos últimos años ha aprendido mucho de este tipo de trabajo y le ha puesto mucho empeño y dedicación al mismo, a su vez también se dedica a alquilar cuartos, lo que le permite generar un ingresos mensual.

El está muy contento por los negocios que tiene y está orgulloso del buen trabajo que viene desarrollando. Aparicio ahora tiene la idea de poder hacer algunos acabados en su casa para que así pueda mejorar su calidad de vida, sabe que ver su casa mucho más bonita lo hará sentirse en mejor ambiente y mucho más motivado junto a sus pequeños, es por este motivo que ha solicitado la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva y espera puedan confiar en él y así ayudarlo a mejorar como persona.

Aparicio sueña con mejorar el segundo piso de su vivienda y también invertir en un negocio mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Aparicio is a 37 year old man, father of 2 children whom he loves very much. Today he lives in the city of Nazca, a place visited by many tourists due to the immense lines drawn in the ground and also for the quality and service of its people.

Aparicio provides tourism services for a living and is proud of the good work being carried out. Aparicio now has the idea of being able to make some finishes on his house so that he can improve his quality of life. He knows that seeing his house much more beautiful will make him feel much more motivated in a better environment with his children. It is for this reason that he is requesting the assistance of the Kiva lenders and hopes they can confide in him and help him to improve as a person.

Aparicio dreams of improving the second floor of his housing and also investing in a much larger business.

loans.use: to do finishes on his home.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: La señora petrona mujer esforzada y de gran valor, expresaba que con la ayuda de Dios y el apoyo que le ha brindado kiva y la micro-financiera ha podido hacerle mejoras a su vivienda en esta ocasión el destino del credito sera para la realizacion del techo del cuarto de su hija menor, haciendo uso de los siguientes materiales: zinc, perlines, golosos, soldaduras entre otros, su plan a futuro es seguir haciendole mejoras a su casa y asi tener la sastifaccion  que les dio una vivienda digna y acogedora a sus familiares.
texts.en: Sra. Petrona is an industrious woman with good values.  She says that with God's help and the support that Kiva has provided with microloans, she has been able to make improvements to her home.  On this occasion, the loan will be used to install a roof over her young daughter's room.  This would require the following materials:  zinc, crossbeams, screws, welding supplies, and other items.  Her plan for the future is to continue making improvements to her house so that she can have the satisfaction of providing a decent and comfortable home for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for installing a roof over her daughter's room.

loans.name: Andres Isidoro

texts.es: Andres tiene 37 años es casado vive con la esposa, y con los hijos Andreina Nicole de 10 años y John Andres de 8 años. La ventanilla se llama CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Jesus del Gran Poder, pertenece al canton Ventanas, se dedica a labores agricolas a mantener los cultivos de naranja, guineo, orito, cacao y café. Andres se dedica a la agricultura a cuidar las plantaciones de cacao, guineo y naranja ya que estos productos son de ciclo largo, las compras las realiza en el canton Ventanas y las vende en el mismo lugar. El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como: abonos, urea, podas, limpieza del terreno de las malas hiervas y evitar enfermedades en los cultivos. El credito le ayudado a incrementar la calidad de los productos y evitar pérdidas en los cultivos. El sueño de Andres es comprar un terreno, obtener mas productos y mayor produccion. Le gusta hacer deporte con su familia y amigos del barrio.
texts.en: Andres is 37; he is married and lives with his wife and two children, Andreina Nicole aged 10, and John Andres aged 8. The communal bank, ‘Caminando hacia el futuro,’ is located in the neighbourhood of Jesus del Gran Poder, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. It is devoted to the farm work involved in maintaining the orange, banana, baby banana, cacao and coffee crops. Andres makes a living in agriculture by looking after the cacao, baby banana and orange plantations, as these products have a long farming cycle. The buying takes place in the canton of Ventanas, and they are sold in the same place. The loan has been requested to buy supplies such as fertilizers, urea and shears to clear the land of weeds and avoid diseases in the crops. The loan has helped him to improve the quality of his products and avoid loss of crops. Andres’ dream is to buy a piece of land, obtain more products and achieve higher production. He likes playing sports with his family and his friends from the neighbourhood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, and shears to clear the land of weeds.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is married and has four children who attend school. He has been a rice farmer for two years. 

Jean Pierre is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get an increased output and earn more money.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and support labor costs.

loans.name: Asyme

texts.fr: Asyme est un jeune père de famille. Il est marié et a trois enfants qui vont tous à l'école arabe.Depuis bientôt 10 ans, il tient une boutique de vente de denrées alimentaires au marché de sa localité.Il subvient ainsi  avec ses revenus aux besoins de sa petite famille et à ses propres besoins. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter 1 tonne de riz et 200 litres d'huile. Son ambition est d'agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Asyme is a young family man. He is married and has 3 children who all go to the Arab school. He has run a shop selling food products at his local market for almost 10 years. His income allows him to take care of his small family's needs, and his own.

In order to strengthen his business, Asyme is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to buy 1 ton of rice and 200 litres of oil. His goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy 1 ton of rice and 200 litres of oil.

loans.name: Tannous

texts.en:
Tannous is a 50-year-old married man and the father of one child. He works in selling special foods & goods through distributing them with the help of his lovely car among villages all over his region. He is a hardworking man, and he sells different goods to meet with his multiple clients' choices and habits. Its been 36 years since he started this business, and it's going on just fine.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his spring-summer merchandise with special drinks and goods requested in this season. He has already experienced Al Majmoua loans before and they had a pleasant effect on both his social and financial situations. At the same time, he was a borrower in good standing. Tannous is willing to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special spring-summer drinks with special discounts.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y una hija, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tostadas de plátano y yuca, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 3:30pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido inconvenientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales necesarios para elaborar la venta como el maíz, leña y gas, esto es lo que le ayudara a María para continuar prestando su servicio, fortaleciéndose con lo necesario.
La aspiración de María es que a través del préstamo su negocio tenga más estabilidad, ganarse más clientes y velar por las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and a daughter; she makes tortillas, fried plantain and fried manioc to sell; she's had the business for four years and works every day from 7am until 3:30pm.  To date, she's had no inconveniences..

She's asking for a loan to buy supplies needed to make the things she sells like corn, firewood and gas.  This is what will help María continue to provide service strengthening herself with what is necessary.  María's hope is that through the loan her business will be more stable, she'll acquire more customers and will be able to take care of her home's neeeds.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and gas.

loans.name: Al-Boshra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-BOSHRA and consists of four members who are all females: Jamila, Sameera, Bushra and Fatima. All of them are friends and from Aden, Yemen. They primarily work together in small business like sewing. The group took a loan of 120,000 YER.

Jamila, 49, (she is the second women from the left with clothes on her lap) is a married woman with two children. She has designed and sold curtains, blinds, and dresses as well as mobile phones and decorations in general, since starting her business one year ago. Initially she only took on simple designs, but as she gradually became more skilled in decorative arts, she added more value to her work. 

Currently she has clients that include important department stores. With the business she gets, she’s been able to expand her location and grow her infrastructure. The quality of her fabrics has allowed her to maintain a select clientele that usually sends her new clients. Her goal is to grow her business and position herself in the market and separate her production space from her family space to achieve tranquility. 

Jamila is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy fabric and needles in large quantities in order to get a discount, as she has orders she’ll be working on. She'll make her investment a success.

loans.use: to buy fabric and needles in large quantities for her business

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 55-year-old married man with eight adult children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

He has been running a silver store for 20 years.

He is a person who has had to pass through many difficulties in his life. However, his desire to work and get ahead has permitted him to overcome them and continue to make progress in life. 

Approximately at the age of 15 years, he had to leave the municipality where he was born due to the violence, and he immigrated to the city of Taiz with the determination to continue with his life. In the city, he worked as an employee in various businesses, but seeing how poorly paid he was, he decided to become independent and open a general store. 

Currently, Mohammed is operating his small silver store, which permits him to generate the necessary income to cover his household expenses. He has very good customers, and this has caused his sales to rise in recent months. 

Currently, Mohammed faces a bad situation in economic stability, and thus he is seeking to request a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy silver for his business, in order to increase the variety of products he offers his customers. 

Mohammed hopes that his business will increase its sales considerably. He also hopes that it will keep generating the income he needs to maintain his household.

loans.use: to buy silver for his business in order to increase the variety of products he offers for customers.

loans.name: Zohair

texts.en:
Zohair is 27 years old, a married man who lives together with his wife in Sana`a,Yemen. His business is buying and selling groceries (grocery store). His store is located in his own home. He has been running his business very well and in recent years it has provided for his family. He started his business with very little working capital but, owing to his commitment, he now has a store with regular customers who provide very good references on the service that he provides which is very popular with the customers. Zohair's store is very popular with his neighbors who provide very good references for both himself and his family.

He would like to continue growing his business as he knows that he still has demands to satisfy. He would like to buy a variety of merchandise and more groceries so that he does not neglect his customers' needs. He is requesting a youth loan for 150,000 YER from AMB so that he can buy grocery items such as rice, soft drinks, mineral water and sugar, etc. that will increase his profit and thus his income.

In the future, he would like to provide his wife with a better quality of life and his future children  with a better education.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as rice, soft drinks, mineral water and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina, es comerciante de ropa y cosméticos, es viuda, tiene un hijo pero no vive con ella, Delfina inicio su negocio hace 4 años, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 3:00pm, este negocio le ha dado lo necesario mediante los ingresos para mantenerse.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la reparación de la vivienda como tejas, cemento, hierro, y pago de mano de obra, con esto podrá arreglar el techo de la casa, y tenerla más segura, y vivir más tranquila.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, mantenerse siempre ocupara con trabajo, para poder cubrirse todos sus gastos y necesidades.
texts.en:
Delfina is a clothes and cosmetics merchant.  She's a widow and has a son but he does not live with her.  Delfina started her business four years ago.  She works every day from 7am until 3pm.  Income earned from the business has provided her with the basics.

She's asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies to repair her home like roofing tiles, cement and iron and to pay labor costs.  With this she'll be able to repair her house's roof so that it will be more secure and she can live more care-free.  Her goal is to improve the business and to stay busy with work in order to cover her needs and expenses.

loans.use: to buy roof tiles, cement and iron and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is married and has four children between three and 15 years old. They all attend school. He has been a rice farmer for nine years, and would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and hire some workers to get the best possible harvest. With the profits earned from this loan, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output and save money.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and hire workers.

loans.name: Jyamberemuhinzi Wa Zone 3 Group

texts.fr:
Fréderic  fait partie du groupe Jyambere Muhinzi wa Zone 3. Il a 34 ans et il est marié, avec 3 enfants de 6 mois à 8 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Fréderic est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilise des semences de race améliore et utilise des engrais chimique. Dans les prochaines années, Fréderic voudrait être un grand agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Frederic is a member of the Jyambere Muhinzi wa Zone 3 group. He is 34 years old and married, with three children ranging from six months to eight years of age, two of whom are in school. His educational level is six grades of primary school.

Frederic is a farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan  to buy fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor. His business strategy is to utilize better-quality seeds and chemical fertilizers. In the years to come, Frederic would like to become a renowned farmer in his region. With his revenues, he plans to pay for the education and care of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 32 años y es Soltero no tiene hijos, pero con el tiempo desea formar una familia, Juan  tiene la actividad de Servicio de Internet y Llamadas Telefónicas, en una tienda que tiene en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Juan  utilizara este préstamo para la compra de una maquina de computación y mantenimiento de su internet, ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para mantenerse y también a sus hermanos y Padres  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de mejorar el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes. Juan  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, los problemas sociales y  utilizara los beneficios del crédito en  mejorar su internet,  desea con el tiempo poder tener m as sucursales de su negocio en la ciudad de Cochabamba y también en algunas de sus provincias, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan, 32, is single and has no children but in time would like to form a family.  Juan has an Internet access and telephone services business in a store located in a very busy zone in the city of Cochabamba.
