Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los carros de carga son muy escasos por esta parte de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Con el crédito solicitado comprará abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP; y se siente muy contenta de saber que obtendrá un apoyo mas por parte de los financistas, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos.

loans.use: Buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sacrée Plus Group

texts.en:
Toussaint is the leader of the Community Bank “Sacrée Plus,”which is composed of 25 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Toussaint sells soft drinks. He started his business in 2007. With his accumulated profits and good management, the business has prospered. Toussaint decided to join one of MFI Hope’s groups in order to achieve his dream of building a facility for storing soft drinks. Currently, his business generates profits of US$129 per month. Toussaint intends to use the next loan to reinforce his working capital by buying fourteen crates of drinks to resell at profit. He is 56 years old, married, and the father of five children whose ages range from 12 to 33 years old. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to reinforce his working capital by buying fourteen crates of drinks to resell at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kowa

texts.en:
This is 50 year-old Kowa. He is married and has 3 children ages 19, 16, and 11.

In 2001, Kowa established his furniture business. He began his business for self empowerment and it is his major source of income. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,700,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Kowa would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy timber. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 420,000 SLL. In the future, Kowa plans to transform his workshop into a modern one with modern equipment, to acquire a showroom for his furniture, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has 4 children ages 16, 13, 10, and 7 years. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is the nephew of his wife.

In 2007, Ibrahim established his motorcycle transport business. He began this business to make him self independent and it is his only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about 1,600,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy a Victor motorcycle. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Ibrahim plans to secure one more motorbike, to develop his land, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Aïssa est une femme mariée sans enfants. Elle vit avec sa mère, son petit frère et son mari. Elle tient une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires devant son domicile.Ce commerce lui permet de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille ainsi que ses propres besoins. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter 4 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d'huile, du sucre et du lait. Son ambition est de construire une boutique.
texts.en:
Aïssa is married and has no children. She lives with her mother, her little brother and her husband. She runs a store selling food products in front of her home. Her business enables her to support her husband in taking care of the family's needs, as well as her own.

In order to strengthen her business, Aïssa is requesting a loan of 150 000 francs with which to buy 4 sacs of rice, 2 cans of oil, sugar and milk. She aims to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacs of rice, 2 cans of oil, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married with two grown daughters.  She graduated from a college of commerce and used to work as a store vendor.  However, economic crisis hit her hard and she was forced to find new ways to provide for her family.  Today she runs a small business selling artificial flowers, dishware and other retail items in the city marketplace.

Lubov’s venture is unique, and she has loyal clientele who help keep her sales high.  Lubov has been in this niche business for nine years. Presently, she has 50,000 Hryvnia in stock, and her average income is about 8,000 Hryvnia a month. 

Lubov is seeking a loan of 20,000 Hryvnia to purchase new merchandise for the spring season.  She believes it will promote the further expansion of her business and ensure a stable source of income for her and her family.  Lubov is very sincere and serves each of her customers with a smile.  Her warm approach to each individual earns her many return customers, which helps her keep a leading position in this business.

loans.use: purchase new merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.ru:
Арамаис  родился в 1953 году в деревне Неркин Анд, Сьюникского региона. Арамаис окончил восемь классов сельской средней школы, а после этого работал механизатором. В данный момент Арамаис работает ночным сторожем в средней школе. 
Арамаис женат и у него четверо детей: три сына и дочь. У всех детей Арамаиса уже есть свои семьи и вместе с Арамаисом живет один из сыновей вместе со своей молодой семьей.  
Уже 30 лет Арамаис занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом. Он разводит крупный рогатый скот, овец, кур и пчел, выращивает овощи, бобовые и ячмень. Также у Арамаиса имеется сельскохозяйственная техника: трактор, пресс для сена и грузовой автомобиль. Сельскохозяйственную продукцию Арамаис продает в городе Капане на рынке. Значительную часть прибыли Арамаис получает благодаря выполнения платных работ с помощью своих сельскохозяйственных механизмов. Занятие сельским хозяйством позволяет Арамаису содержать семью. 
Арамаису необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для покупки нескольких поросят, семян для посева, а также для ремонта сельскохозяйственной техники.
texts.en: Aramayis was born 1953 in the Nerkin And village in Syunik region.  He completed eight grades of a secondary school and then worked as a mechanic.  Currently, Aramayis works as a night security guard at a secondary school.  Aramayis is married and has four children - three sons and a daughter.  All of his children already have their own families, and only one of his sons and his young family live together with Aramayis.  Aramayis has been involved in an agricultural business for 30 years.  He breeds cattle and sheep, keeps chickens and bees and grows vegetables, beans and barley.  Aramayis also has agricultural machinery, such as a tractor, press for hay and a truck.  He sells his agricultural produce at a market in the city of Kapan.  He makes the primary share of his profit thanks to doing paid work with his agricultural machinery.  Involvement in the agricultural business allows Aramayis to support his family.  Aramayis needs a loan in the amount of 800,000 dram to buy several piglets, seeds for sowing and also to repair his agricultural machinery.

loans.use: to buy several piglets, seeds for sowing, and to repair agricultural machinery

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: Malick est un jeune commerçant de 22 ans qui s’active depuis 4 ans. Il s’est très tôt lancé dans les affaires. Il possède un magasin de pièces détachées à la gare routière. Il faut aussi noter qu’en dehors de ce métier, Malick fait aussi du transport. Il a décidé de faire un crédit pour acheter  une moto Djakarta afin de pouvoir diversifier ses sources de revenus. Il n’a pas de charges car il est célibataire sans enfant ; c’est pourquoi  il réinvesti son bénéfice dans le magasin. Avec l’appui des préteurs, il compte élargir son domaine d’activité à des champs plus variés et susceptibles de générer du profil.
texts.en:
Malick is a young shopkeeper of 22 years of age, who has been working for 4 years. He went into business at a young age and owns a shop selling spare parts at the bus station. As well as running his shop, he also provides transportation services.

Malick has decided to apply for a loan to buy a Jakarta motorcycle so that he can diversify his revenue sources. He has no financial responsibilities as he is single and has no children, which is why he reinvest his profits into his shop. With the support of the lenders, he intends to extend his business activities into more diverse areas likely to generate a profit.

loans.use: to buy a Jakarta motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Alhassan. He is married and has two children ages 3 years and 4 months. He has two additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives.

In 2006, Alhassan established his building materials and rice business. He began his business just to enable him to adequately cater to his family, and it is his only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,800,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Alhassan would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy cement. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Alhassan plans to establish a branch in Bo, to travel to the holy land of Mecca, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of cement for his business.

loans.name: Mohamed Turay Ii

texts.en:
Mohamed is 44 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  His wife is a trader who makes 200,000 SLL in sales per day. In 1990, Mohamed established his used handbags, schoolbags, and purses business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about  6,744,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Mohamed is requesting his second loan for 4,000,000 SLL, which he will use to purchase used handbags, school bags, and traveling bags.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1,012,000 SLL. In the future, Mohamed plans to engage in the wholesale business. 

Mohammed feels good about the loan because it helps both in his domestic and business affairs.  He wants to educate his children and these loans enable him to generate more income.  The shortage of goods is his major business problem.  His competition is great as several people are in the same business line.  He goes for quality bales to better his competitors.  

Mohammed began doing business when he was a boy.  He was not able to attend school because he was from a poor home.  He serves about 40 people per day mostly peddlers and ladies.  His business is popular because he has customer care strategies.  He has one assistant, a distant cousin, who usually goes to Freetown to buy his goods twice per month.  

Mohamed saved his profits to build a house and he is now looking forward to expanding his business through the help of this credit service.

loans.use: to purchase used handbags, schoolbags, and traveling bags.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 58 year-old Mohamed. He is married to a trader, and has 8 children aged 30, 26, 24, 20, 18, 16, 15 and 14 years. Four of his children are still going to school. 

In 1972, Mohamed established his rubber slippers and sandals business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL7,542,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase plastic sandals (6 cartons @ SLL400,000, women slippers - 20 pkts @ SLL120,000, the balance SLL200,000 is to be used for transportation costs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL1,131,000. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to see his four school-aged children go through higher educational institutions. His feeling is good as his business has helped him a lot. He is not nervous about it as, when he retires, his children will continue from where he will stop. He wants his children be well educated and to expand his business.  

The loans help Mohamed's business as it is an addition source of income. He serves retailers in town and in neighboring villages. His business is popular because he offers quality products at affordable prices that suit his customers’ earnings. He has no employee; he and his wife are running the business.  His suppliers are located in Guinea (Conakry) where he usually goes three times in the month by public vehicle. He serves about 40 people per day, mostly peddlers and ladies. His business is popular because he has customers' care strategies. He only has one assistant - a distant cousin. He usually goes to Freetown to buy his goods twice per month by public transport.  Mohamed saved his profits to develop his incomplete building. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase plastic sandals - 6 cartons @ SLL400,000, women slippers - 20 pkts @ SLL120,000, the balance SLL200,000 is to be used for transportation.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Daniel.  He is married and his spouse is a business woman. He has 5 children, aged 15, 12, 8, 5 and 3 years. 

In 2005, Daniel established his spare parts business, selling clutches, fan belts, brake oil, engine oil, filters, bearings, brake pads, brake liners, carbon brushes, spokes, etc.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,891,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Daniel has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans. He now requires a new loan in order to purchase the following items: clutches - 30 sets @ SLL80,000 and fan belts - 80 pieces @ SLL20,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 283,600. 

In the future, Daniel plans to educate his children, build a shop, and construct another house. He feels happy about taking this loan and it will help to generate more income. He serves 20 customers each day. His business is popular because he sells spare parts and also fixes the vehicles up for his customers. He is assisted by his family members. His suppliers are located in Freetown. He travels to get his goods by public transport. He buys his goods at least twice per month. Some of the profits are being ploughed back into the business and some to solve domestic problems. He has the plans to expand and this can be achieved by continuously accessing loans from ARD. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clutches - 30 sets @ SLL80,000 and fan belts - 80 pieces @ SLL20,000.

loans.name: Mohamed Unisa Kalokoh

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Mohamed. He is married and has one child who is 6 years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is in school. 

In 2006, Mohamed established his mobile phone and accessories business. He began this business because he wanted to provide his basic needs after leaving school and it is his only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 950,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy Nokia phones, Nokia batteries, memory cards, and Motorola chargers for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Mohamed plans to establish a large mobile shop, to own a house, and to educate his child.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 25 year-old Ibrahim. He is married to a business woman and has 1 child, aged 4 years, who is going to school. In 2005, Ibrahim established his business selling mobile phones, phone batteries, top-up cards, ear phones, phone chargers, memory cards, MPs and drinks. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,954,500 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to purchase the following items: mobile phones - 16 pieces @ SLL 250,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 295,450. 

In the future, Ibrahim plans to build a house, provide a quality education for his child and to have a shop. He feels happy about taking this loan as it will help him to increase his income. His major problem is with the phone batteries because customers will buy them and sometimes returns them for being damaged. He serves over 100 customers each day. His business is popular. He is assisted by his spouse. His suppliers are located in Freetown. He transports his goods by public vehicle and he makes purchases twice in a month. He ploughs some of his profit into the business and uses the balance to buy building materials. He is planning to expand and this can be accomplished by managing the business well. Ibrahim is trust worthy and hardworking.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones - 16 pieces @ SLL 250,000.

loans.name: Isatu B.

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Isatu B. She is married to a contractor and has 4 children, aged 15, 13, 11 and 8 years. All are school going children. In 1996, Isatu B established her baby clothing and utensils business. She began her business because she came from a poor background; she had to do petty trading after school hours to pay her school fees. Things got harder for her because she had to drop out of school. She was peddling everyday to help her parents and younger ones. She then got married and her husband helped her with a small amount of funds for the business. Since then, she has developed gradually. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 5,481,000 every month from this business. 

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Isatu B has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase baby wrappers - 4 dozen @ SLL 216,000, baby powder - 10 dozen @ SLL 80,000, baby walkers - 4 dozen @ SLL 180,000 and flasks - 2 dozen @ SLL 720,000, the balance of SLL 176,000 is to be used for transportation costs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 822,000. 

In the future, Isatu B plans to build a house. The loan is another source of generating income, so it is good. She is nervous because she has worked very hard to be where she is now, and she wants her business to grow bigger. She hopes her children will be better people in society. She wants them to achieve what she has not been as fortunate to get. Her only challenge is the fluctuation in transportation costs. Her competitors are few, besides she has more items than they do and of better quality.   

Isatu serves about 30 customers per day, women and petty traders around town and villages. Her business is popular because she always has good customer care and good quality goods at affordable prices. She usually travels by vehicle three times in the month. and to Conakry once every two months to purchase her goods. She saves some of her profit and uses some as an additional capital for the business.  

She has enough savings now that she has acquired a piece of land which she is looking forward to develop. She is also planning to expand her business by acquiring more loans and saving enough of her profit. She is hard working and competitive. Isatu B wants to achieve her dreams by educating her children through acquiring subsequent loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase baby wrappers - 4 dozen @ SLL 216,000, baby powder - 10 dozen @ SLL 80,000, baby walkers - 4 dozen @ SLL180,000 and flasks - 2 dozen @ SLL720,000, the balance of SLL 176,000 is to be used for transportation costs.

loans.name: Kaliman

texts.ru: Калиман 60 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. Калиман 35 лет проработала продавцом в магазине, сейчас на пенсии. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Калиман занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2002 году с покупки двух бычков на сумму 25,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Калиман, ее поголовье насчитывает 2 коровы, 1 лошадь, 4 бычка и 5 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калиман обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Калиман планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение поголовья.
texts.en: Kaliman is 60 years old and married. She has brought up four children. For 35 years Kaliman used to work as a store salesperson. Now she is retired. In order to provide income for her family, Kaliman raises livestock. Having started in 2002 by purchasing two bulls costing 25,000 KGS, she now has a farm brining in about 15,000 KGS monthly from sales of dairy and milk product. Thanks to Kaliman’s hard work, her livestock now includes two cows, one horse, four bulls and five sheep. In order to develop her business further, Kaliman turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS intended for purchasing livestock. Kaliman plans to invest her revenues into increasing her livestock further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Hamza. He is married and has three children ages 12, 9, and 6 years.

In 2006, Hamza established his mobile phone and accessories business. He began this business just for self empowerment and it provides a solution to his problems. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 950,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Hazma would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy mobile phones and accessories. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Hamza plans to complete the construction of his house, to rent a house, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef, from Gaza, works as a carpenter in his own business. He is 33 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children. On the 1st of January 2011, Yousef started his project. He hopes to get this loan in order to buy a saw, which will increase production capacity, leading to increased profit and income.

loans.use: to buy a saw.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, a 60-year-old married mother of seven children, lives in Masindi Uganda where she has been involved in farming since she was 20. While price fluctuations and seasonal weather hinder her business, her dream is to build a permanent house and buy a motorcycle. Mary intends to use this loan to pay workers who are clearing land for maize growing.

loans.use: to pay workers who are clearing land for maize growing.

loans.name: Martha Del Rosario

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de 57 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ganados su historia empezó cuando realizaba y venta de cerdos y la Sr. Martha aprendió de él y comenzó también en este comercio, su trabajo lo hace sola todas las tardes, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene 5 hijos, su sueño más importante es desea acondicionar las chancherías para tener mejor producción y salud para seguir adelante. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de ganado y asi comprar cerdos.
texts.en:
Martha is a 57-year-old woman who has many aspirations for the next years, including to prosper in selling livestock. Her story began with Martha raising and selling pigs, as she learned about it, and beginning to enter the trade. She works alone every afternoon, without difficulties. 

Martha isn't married and has 5 children. Her most important dream is her desire to improve her pigpens so she can increase production and animal health and forge ahead. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to assist in livestock sales and, also, to buy more pigs.

loans.use: To improve her pigpens and to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Développement Plus Group

texts.en:
Henri is a leader of the Community Bank named “Développement Plus,” which consists of 12 members. These members are jointly united for receiving loans from Kiva and HOPE DRC in order to develop their businesses.

Henri has been a micro entrepreneur since 2000. He sells vehicle spare parts in the southwestern part of Kinshasa. He joined one Hope’s groups in 2010. Seven loans received from Hope have strengthened his business. He is planning with the next loan to increase his inventory by adding some vehicle spares pieces to resell at profit. Currently, Henri’s business makes about $200 of profit per month.

Henri is ambitious and dreams someday to open a spare parts shop. Henri is 46 years old, married, and the father of five children. Their ages vary between 2 and 18 years. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase some vehicle spares parts for reselling at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia lives in Masindi-Uganda where she has the responsibility of taking care of her three children. Scovia started a salon three years ago, and while facing the challenges posed by price fluctuations, inflation and transportation costs, she is now requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for sale and use in her salon.

She desires to educate her children, buy a car, diversify her business and hire employees to help expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for sale and use in her salon.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 29 and charged with the responsibility for taking care of his four children and wife. He used to work as a civil servant, but with two million UGX that he saved from his monthly salary, he opened a bar and phone accessories shop in Masindi, Uganda.

Jonathan is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM in order to buy tents, chairs and tables to rent to customers. He wants to educate his children, build a permanent house and through his business earn twenty million UGX in working capital by 2014.

loans.use: to buy tents, chairs and tables to rent to customers.

loans.name: Hilton

texts.en:
Hilton, 39, is married with four children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a farmer and has been doing well despite the challenges presented by unpredictable seasonal weather and price fluctuations.

Hilton intends to use a 1,600,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to prepare his fields ahead of the planting season. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to prepare his fields ahead of the planting season.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo como docente peron la socia ya no trabaja como profesora ,ahora la socia se esta dedicando al negocio de venta y elaboracion de manualidades,ella hace trabajos en pintura,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las manualidades.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales como hilos,pinturas y maderas.

Juana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member previously worked as a teacher, but she doesn´t teach anymore. Now she is working in the handicraft making and selling business; she does craftwork with paint. The member works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Through this little business, she keeps her children going. The member’s dream is to have premises where she can sell her handicrafts. She is requesting this loan to purchase materials such as thread, paint and wood. 
Juana is grateful for the opportunity given here and, likewise, she promises to carry out the payment according to schedule.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as thread, paint and wood.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, 37, is married with four children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He runs a grocery shop that has enabled him to support his family. Price fluctuations and inflation, customers who do not pay on time and thieves affect his business.

Richard wants a 2,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy sugar, salt and rice to sell from his shop. His dream is to educate his children, buy a motorcycle and diversify his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and rice to sell from his shop.

loans.name: Maraman

texts.en:
Maraman is a 38-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Maraman is a women stylist; she is well-known in her area and is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase equipment needed to improve her home salon.

Maraman is looking to open a beauty salon so that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed to improve her salon.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric, 32, is married and lives in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows tea, a common source of income in this region. He inherited the fields upon which he grew up and now grows tea. Droughts that cause his tea crops to dry up are his challenge.

Eric is asking for a 2,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy manure and pesticides for his tea plantation. He dreams of building a permanent home and educating his two children.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is married and owns a transport business. The motorcycle transport is a major business opportunity in the region due to the lack of good road networks in most areas. He purchased the motorcycle with his savings.

Salim is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to repair the motorcycle and also to help him start another business. He looks forward to owning a three-wheeler vehicle in the near future or to purchase a taxi or van for transport.

The challenges facing Salim’s current business are the seasonal business climate and the overall inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle transport and also to start another transport business

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo, age 52, owns a motorcycle spare parts shop in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He accumulated his start-up capital from selling produce. 

He would like to obtain a loan in order to buy motorcycle spare parts to offer for resale. 

Leo dreams of providing for the education of his eight children and expanding his business into new markets

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to offer for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, age 40, owns and operates a retail shop. He began as a farmer, and he is still engaged in farming to supplement his retail shop business.

John hopes to obtain a loan to buy sugar and sodas to offer for sale in his shop. 

His dream is to provide for his children's education and to grow his shop to wholesale status.

loans.use: to buy sugar and sodas to offer for sale in his shop

loans.name: Ever Jose

texts.es: Ever, continua laborando como mesero en uno de los restaurantes de nuestra ciudad  de Nicaragua, es un caballero luchador que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos , razon por la que necesita en esta ocasión el financiamiento  es para la instalacion de puertas y ventanas en su vivienda, mismas que le otorgaran a su propiedad mayor seguridad y proteccion para sus hijos; asi como tambien ocupara el credito para la puesta de piso de ceramica. Uno de sus grandes metas en la vida es llegar a construir la division de los cuartos de su hogar, con el principal objetivo de brindarle a su familia mejor privacidad, agradece el apoyo incondicional de parte de Afodenic y kiva.
texts.en: Ever is still working as a waiter in one of the restaurants in the city of Managua. He is a hard-working gentleman who has known how to help his children get ahead. For this reason he needs a loan to install doors and windows in his home in order to increase the security and protection of his children in the home. He will also use the loan to put in a ceramic floor. One of his biggest life goals is to build room dividers in his home, with the principal objective of providing his family with better privacy. He is thankful for the unconditional support of Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: install windows and doors in his home

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is a 38-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Saba is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 300 JD to do maintenance for her home.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a conservative person, so she in unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man  in the photo is her husband.

Heba is a 31-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Heba is selling accesories and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

Heba is looking to purchase a small van so that she can distribute her products door-to-door and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for business purposes

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 25-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Heba is woman stylist. She has a salon at her home and is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase new cosmetics. Becuase Heba is under 30 years old her loan is considered to be a youth loan.

Heba is looking to establish her own salon outside of her home so that she can increase her income and insure a better life for her small family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products for her home-based salon

loans.name: Raniah

texts.en:
Raniah is a 33-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Raniah is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to pay for a new bedroom for her children.

Raniah is looking to do full maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to pay for a new bedroom for her children

loans.name: Salem Gs1 Group

texts.en:
Bijoux is the chairwoman of a Community bank named “Salem GS1,” which is composed of 5 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.
 
Bijoux sells sacks of cement and beverages in detail. She has been in business since 1983. She has a solid experience in her business and it has prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received fourteen different loans and has repaid them correctly. She intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing more sacks of cement and beverages to resell in order to generate additional profits. Currently, she earns a profit of US $150 every week. 

Bijoux is 47 years old, a widow and the mother of six children between 16 and 31 years old. Two of them go to school. Her dream is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing more sacks of cement and beverages to resell in order to generate additional profits.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a married father of two children, both of whom are pursuing a college education.

Alex has run a retail shop for the last six years. Besides this, he also owns a taxi which he uses to transport people around the area. He is a retired employee and receives a monthly pension from his previous employment.

Alex is applying for a loan of 60,000 KES from Milango Financial to use to add stock to his shop and repair and upgrade his taxi. He believes that his two businesses will help provide an enjoyable life for his family. He also looks forward to constructing a permanent house in the near future.

loans.use: to add stock to his shop and repair and upgrade his taxi.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward wants a loan to buy beans to sell.  The thirty-one-year-old, hardworking man wants to own a grocery shop that he can turn into a supermarket.  Having received the previous loan, he has saved money and has started up a shop for his wife, enabling the family to have diverse incomes.  His dream is to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 33-year-old motorcycle spares parts dealer.  He acquired his start-up capital from the sale of produce.  He now wants to invest in rental houses as these provide a source of sustainable income.  Therefore, he is requesting another loan to enable him to buy land on which to construct a house to rent out.

loans.use: to buy land on which to constuct a house to rent out.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy owns a taxi, which he uses to transport people and goods within the town of of Changamwe, Kenya. He was previously employed, saved some money, and purchased his taxi with his savings. He and his wife have two children.
 
Kennedy is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to repair his vehicle, including its engine, and to repaint the car in order to attract more business. The primary challenge to his business is high fuel costs. Nevertheless, Kennedy is focused on purchasing more vehicles in future. 

He will use the additional income obtained from this loan to start another business.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle, including its engine, and to repaint the car in order to attract more business

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald runs a bicycle transport business in the area around Changamwe, Kenya. This mode of transport is preferred by many who lack enough money for transport and also for movement within short distances in the area. He began the business three years ago together with his brother, who offers him support and motivation. The challenge facing the current business is bicycle theft and lack of customers at certain times of the day.

Donald and his wife have three children.

Donald was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to add on to his savings, purchase a motorcycle, and set up a retail shop.

Donald will save the additional income generated from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle and set up a retail shop

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama operates a "chop bar," where she prepares and sells a variety of African dishes. She has run this business for the past five years. The food items she serves are fufu, banku, and rice balls. 

Ama lives together with her husband and five dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase foodstuffs and ingredients needed to prepare the food she offers for sale. With the new profit, Ama plans to create a better place to serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and ingredients needed to prepare the food she offers for sale

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 51-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of 11 children.

Sabah is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance for her home.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home

loans.name: Sowali

texts.en:
Sowali, now thirty, is married and has six children. He has been involved in the taxi business for the last eight years. His operation has proved to be very lucrative.

Sowali intends to use a 1,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy new tires for his taxi. His dream is to own at least three more taxis within the next six years.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson wants another loan to buy maize to resell.  Having started by growing various crops, he saved money for the produce business that he now runs.  His dream is to export produce and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent keeps poultry to earn her living, a business she has run for over two years. In addition, she owns a clothing boutique. She is the single mother of one child and lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She started the business with a capital of 30,000 shillings. 

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 90,000 Kenya shillings, which she will use to purchase clothing items such as shirts, skirts, shoes, and trousers to offer for sale. Her main challenge is overall inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. She also faces some customer debt delinquency.

Her aim is to own a large shop in future. She will use the additional income obtained from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items such as shirts, skirts, shoes, and trousers to offer for sale

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack owns a garage business in Changamwe, Kenya. The garage has been in operation for the past year. Shadrack started the business from the money obtained through the sale of his family assets. He is unmarried. The primary challenges faced by the business is the high cost of transportation and competition for existing clients.

He joined Milango last year and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings in order to purchase a car-washing machine so that he can offer car cleaning.

Shadrack’s future ambitions include buying a commercial plot for development. He has also started working on owning a licensed garage.

loans.use: to purchase a car-washing machine so that he can offer car cleaning

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a taxi owner in Changamwe, Kenya. He has operated his taxi business for the past seven years. He was previously employed as a driver and accumulated savings, which he used to purchase the car. His primary challenge is client debt delinquency and the high cost of fuel.

Alexander and his wife have one child.

Alexander learned about Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings in order to open a retail business. 

His ambition is to purchase more cars in future.

loans.use: to open a retail business

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Yasmeen is a 34-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of four children. She has a mutual business with her husband: she works hand-in-hand with him to provide the family with better living conditions.

Yasmeen makes perfumes and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase materials needed. She is looking to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in making perfumes

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, age 30, raises and sells pigs to earn her living. She has operated this business for six years. She has a good number of pigs in her barn and she would like to acquire additional piglets. She also wants to buy pig feed and work on improving the barn. 

For these reasons, she has applied for a loan of PHP 20,000.

Rowena is a married woman who lives with her spouse.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 31-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Ola makes milk products from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed in making dairy products.

Ola is looking to improve her business as well as her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in making dairy products

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa (or Maria Theresa) is 33 years old, married and has three children. The family is from Calabayan, a neighborhood of Ozamiz City in Misamis Occidental province. For the past five years she has worked a banana plantation, earning 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ma. Theresa joined GDMPC to gain access to their financial services. She is requesting a loan of 7,810 PHP which will be used to purchase additional banana seeds, seedlings and young plants. She plans to use her profits to expand her plantation.

loans.use: to purchase additional banana seeds, seedlings and young plants.

loans.name: Feliciana Del Socorrro

texts.es: Feliciana, una señora emprendedora y con metas a futuro, gracias a los financiamientos ofrecidos  por kiva y Afodenic  ha podido salir adelante ir mejorando su vivienda y a la vez su negocio de comideria. Con el credito solicitado desea realizar compras que ayuden al crecimiento mismo de su negocio tales como: ropa nueva para damas, caballeros  y niños,  cosmeticos y productos para su comideria, siendo su trabajo la principal fuente de ingresos para la subsitencia de ella y sus familiares,: la señora señalaba a su vez que su meta a futuro es ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida a los suyos.
texts.en:
Feliciana is an enterprising woman with goals for the future.  Thanks to the loans provided by Kiva and Afodenic she has been able to get ahead improving her home and her food business.

She wishes to use the requested loan to make purchases that will help her business grow.  She will buy things like new clothes for women, men, and children, cosmetics, and food products.  Her work is the main source of income for her subsistence and that of her family.  She indicates that her future goal is to improve the living conditions of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, a 39-year-old widow, is from the village of La Salette in Isabela province. She sells a variety of products like drinks and snack foods to support her children.

Imelda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI to buy groceries like canned goods, snack foods, noodles and drinks to sell. She hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her shop.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a business selling clothes in the Philippines.   Ritchel has been in this business for 4 years.

Ritchel requested a 11,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more clothing to sell.  In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ivonne Del Socorro

texts.es: Ivonne, comerciante, mujer trabajadora, con empeño de salir adelante dia a dia. Expresa la señora que mediante su buen deseo de superacion colabora a que su familia goce de mejores condiciones economicas; en esta ocasión la razon que le impulso a solicitar el financiamiento es para la compra de articulos tales como: sillas, mesas, ropa, cosmeticos y una vitrina que le ayudara a mostrar a sus clientes los productos que vende por catalogo, con el objetivo de llegar a engrandecer su negocio y asi de esa manera obtener mayores ganacias ; agradece la confianza dada por la micro-financiera y kiva que han sido los medios para que ella pueda alcanzar sus metas propuestas en esta vida.
texts.en:
Ivonne, a merchant, is a hard-working woman with determination to get ahead day to day.  She says that through her good desire to improve she works so that her family enjoys better financial conditions.

This time the reason she is requesting the loan is to buy items like chairs, tables, clothes, cosmetics, and a display case.  This will help her show her customers the products that she sells by catalog.  Her objective is for her business to get bigger.  This way she will have greater income.

She is grateful for the trust given to her by the micro-finance entity and Kiva.  They have been the means to her being able to achieve her proposed life goals.

loans.use: to buy items like chairs, tables, clothes, cosmetics, and a display case.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: For her third loan cycle, Julieta is borrowing 13,000 PHP to fund her variety store. This business was previously funded through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF).  Kiva continues to provide her and her family with income that improves their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 53 years old, married and has thirteen children. For the past four years she has run a general store. She also earns an income from a motorcycle taxi service. Merlinda works hard to provide for her family.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid off eight loans from NWTF prior to this one. She is now requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her store.

Merlinda aspires to grow and expand her store so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Hilaria Rosaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria Rosaria es casada, tiene 27 años de edad, cursó el tercer años de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía, al bordado de blusas típicas, inicio este trabajo como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la reparación de autos.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos de diferente clases y colores, para poder mejorar su producción  de bordados,  espera en el futuro su negocio sea prospero y propio a que hasta al momento sigue siendo operaria.
texts.en:
Hilaria, 27, is married and studied up through the third year of elementary school. She has 3 children, two of whom are in school. She works making artisan crafts and sewing traditional blouses. She started this businesses herself two years ago, and has the support of her husband who repairs cars. 

She is asking for a loan which she will use to buy different colors and types of thread, so as to improve her embroidery business. She hopes that in the future her business will be prosperous, and to continue her ownership of the business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old and married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a mobile vending business from which she sells grocery items in the Philippines.  Vilma has run the mobile grocery business for 20 years and also earns income by buying and selling fruit.

Vilma requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more stock to sell.  Prior to this loan, she has borrowed and repaid two other loans from NWTF.  Vilma aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock to sell

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 52 years old.  She is married and has three children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Soledad is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Soledad has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 31 years old.  She is married and has two children.

Amelita works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari store, or general store, in the Philippines.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional items to stock and to sell.

Prior to this loan, Amelita has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF.  She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling copra, dried coconut meat used for oil production.

Amelita aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to stock and sell.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain tiene 41 años de edad, está casado, tiene  5 hijos de 7,13,16, 20 y 24 años de edad, dos de ellos están estudiando, vive con su familia en Intibucá.
Efrain, es muy trabajador, tiene su propio negocio, desde hace diez años se dedica a la ebanistería, donde hace todo tipo de muebles como puertas, mesas, sillas, roperos, ventanas, etc. el trabaja todo el día en esta actividad y le gusta mucho este oficio. 
Inicio con esfuerzos propios, poco a poco ha hecho crecer el negocio, y con la ayuda de los préstamos ha podido comprar maquinaria y herramientas necesarias.
Actualmente está solicitando el tercer préstamo de 3,000.00 Lempiras para comprar  madera para elaborar muebles. 
Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y con las utilidades ayudar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Efrain, age 41, is married and has five children, ages 7, 13, 16, 20, and 24.  Two of them are in school.  He lives with his family in Intibucá.

Efrain is a very hard-worker, and he has his own business.  He has devoted himself to cabinetmaking for ten years.  He makes all types of furniture like doors, tables, chairs, wardrobes, and windows, etc.  He works all day at this business activity, and he likes this trade very much.

He started with his own efforts.  Little by little he has made his business grow.  With the help of the loans he has been able to buy machinery and needed tools.

He is currently requesting his third loan for 3,000 lempiras to buy wood to make furniture.

His goal is to make his business grow and to use the profits to help with his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: El Rincon Group

texts.es:
Lucila tienen 38 años y es parte del grupo “EL RINCON” en su comunidad todavía predomina la cultura Mazahua donde las mujeres usan vestimentas y hablan el mazahua. Luci como de cariño le dicen está casada con Antonio  y tienen cinco hijos de nombres Alexis, Marco Antonio, Mercedes, Edgar y Diana los dos últimos estudian la secundaria, y el menor Alexis el cual estudia primaria. 

Ella se dedica a vender fruta de temporada que ella cultiva y hace vestimentas de la cultura mazahua las cuales las vende en su comunidad desde hace más de 20 años. Platica que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y para insecticidas ya que tiene varios árboles de aguacate, de durazno, guayabas, andrinas y chiles manzanos también abeces cultiva rábanos y jitomates en su casa ya que tiene un terreno muy amplio y cuando es temporada de cosecha dice que vende sus frutos y legumbres en la central de abastos de una poblacion cerca a su comunidad. Dice que con ese negocio lleva un poco mas de 5 años y que fue muy bueno en emprenderlo ya que le deja muy buenas ganancias y así puede darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y así le puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella está muy contenta porque se ha superado atravez de los créditos y poco a poco está haciendo su sueño realidad tener su huerto en buenas condiciones. Una de sus metas es comprar un vehículo donde se le facilite el transporte de sus frutas y legumbres ya que paga flete para transportar lo que cultiva. 

Los otros 3 integrantes del grupo se llaman Gonzalo, Jose Juan y Aucencio los cuales invertirán en su créditos en frutas y legumbres de temporada y abarrotes.
texts.en:
Lucila is 38 years old and is part of the "El Rincon" group. The Mazahua culture still predominates in this community, where the women wear Mazahua traditional clothing and speak Mazahua. Luci, as her friends and family call her,, is married to Antonio, and they have five children, named Alexis, Marco Antonio, Mercedes, Edgar, and Diana. The last two are in secondary school, and the youngest, Alexis, is in primary school. 

Luci sells seasonal fruits that she grows, and she makes typical clothing of the Mazahua culture, which she has been selling in her community for more than 20 years. She says that she is applying for a loan for the purchase of organic fertilizers and for insecticides, since she has a number of avocado, peach, guava, and black cherry trees. She also sometimes grows manzano chile peppers, radishes, and tomatoes at her house, since she has ample land, and when it is the harvest season she says that she sells her fruits and vegetables in a central area in her community. She says that she has been in this business a little more than 5 years and that she did well when she set it up, since it gives her good earnings and thus she can give her children a better quality of life and help her husband with the household expenses. She is very happy because through the loans she has set her sights every higher, and little by little she is making her dream -- to have an orchard in good condition -- a reality. One of her goals is to buy a vehicle, which will facilitate the transport of her fruits and vegetables, since she pays freight charges to transport what she grows. 

The other three members of the group are Gonzalo, Jose Juan, and Aucencio, who will invest their loans in seasonal fruits and vegetables and groceries.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and insecticides, since she has a number of avocado, peach, guava, and black cherry trees, as well as manzano chile peppers, radishes, and tomatoes

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres trabajando esta conformado por trece mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican a la venta y elaboración de ropa típica.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Honoria una señora de sesenta y siete años de edad.
Ella se caracteriza como una señora trabajadora y alegre que desde pequeña a trabajado y a sabido como  cuesta llevarse el pan a la boca.
Ella se dedica a la venta de   dulces desde el más barato como el más caro se va a las fiestas de su localidad par que sus paisanos le compren sus dulces.
Ella nos cuenta que le gusta mucho vender sus dulces por que le deja buenas ganancias y desde hace diez años se ha dedicado a ala venta de dulces.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de más dulces e hilos y manta para la elaboración de ropa típica ya que le gusta mucho tejer pero lo que mas le gusta y es su vida es la venta de dulces ya que le agrada mucho vender sus dulces por las calles de su comunidad.
 Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Sofía-se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Francisca Felisa  - se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Alba-se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Aloína- se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Sebastiana Hermila-se dedica a la venta de típica.
Victoria Maria- se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Emilia-se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Catalina- se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Sofía Honoria - se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Dominga – se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Julia Lucia - se dedica a la venta de ropa típica.
Gabriela- se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y ropa típica. 

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les da a las mujeres trabajadoras que desean mejorar su vidas y de su familia y vestir a sus paisanos por trajes típicos y ellos por manos mexicanas.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Trabajando and is made up of thirteen hardworking women who work selling and making traditional clothing.  One of the members of this group is Honoria, a 66-year-old woman.  She is a hardworking and happy woman who has worked since she was little and has learned how difficult it is to have food to eat.

She works selling sweets, from the cheapest to the most expensive.  She goes to parties in her community so her fellow community members can buy sweets from her.  She tells us that she likes selling her sweets a lot because it gives her good profits.  She has worked selling sweets for ten years.

She requested the loan to buy more candy, and thread and fabric to make traditional clothing.  She very much likes to weave but what she most likes, and it is her life, is selling candy because it pleases her a lot to sell her candy in the streets of her community.

The other members of the group are Sofía, Francisca Felisa, Alba, Eloína, Sebastiana Hermila, Victoria María, Emilia, Catalina, Sofía Honoria, Dominga, and Julia Lucía, who sell traditional clothing; and Gabriela, who sells groceries and traditional clothing.  They are grateful to the foundation for the support it gives to hardworking women who want to improve their lives and those of their families, and to dress themselves and their compatriots in traditional outfits with Mexican labor.

loans.use: to buy sweets, and thread and fabric to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Tynisha

texts.en: Tynisha has been operating a property management company for over two years and just transformed it into her own fully-functioning limited liability company. She works as a property manager for several different property owners, making the link between qualified tenants and a rental agreement. She provides the service of screening the applicant and recommending them for a fitting property if they qualify. In addition to this, she is the point of contact, in place of the property owners, for the tenants to contact with any problems. She is applying for this loan to expand her marketing and her home office to grow her business. She would also like this loan to double as a working credit line for her business.

loans.use: to increase marketing efforts and expand her home office.

loans.name: Javier Coronado Arellana

texts.es: Javier es un joven de 30 años de edad que vie con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad  en un municipio ubicado  a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla; allí tiene una microempresa   donde presta el servicio de llamadas, recargas y venta de sim cards, también comercializa morrales y productos de confitería; él y su esposa trabajan juntos  generando  ingresos para   cubrir todos los gastos familiares. Su negocio tiene 4 años de estar funcionando, después de quedar desempleado. Javier desea incrementar el surtido de su oferta e incluir en este negocio equipos Celulares y otras mercancías, pero ante la creciente demanda su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para responder a esté propósito. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará   teléfonos celulares y   productos de papelería. Su meta mas adelante es agregar una sala de internet. Mientras se esmera  en trabajar su negocio maneja una rentabilidad no menor del 27,50% , desde la cual planea  su crecimiento con su nueva inversión.
texts.en:
Javier is a young man who is 30 years of age and lives with his wife and five-year-old son in a town located 10 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. There he has a small enterprise where he provides calling services, sells and reloads SIM cards, and offers backpacks and candy. He and his wife work together in order to generate income to cover all of their family expenses. His business was started four years ago after he became unemployed. Javier wants to increase the stock of products that he offers and include cellular phone equipment and other merchandise. Prior to experiencing growth in demand, his operating capital was insufficient for being able to respond to this situation. For this reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Javier will use the money to buy cellular phones and stationery products. His goal moving forward is to add an Internet café. In the meantime, he manages to maintain a profitability rate of no less than 27.5%. This signals the growth from his new investment.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones and stationery products.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin, a Florida native, has always had a strong urge to help the community around him. After spending many years in the corporate world, he noticed a need for professional counseling in the young professionals around him. He saw the potential that many of his co-workers were capable of reaching, and recognized that they needed encouragement and guidance to reach it. Bearing this in mind, Kevin started his own business in 2012 in order to help people in need of professional education and counseling.
Through his business, U-Strive Coaching, Kevin aims to develop young students and professionals to their full potential. Along with professional counseling, Kevin also offers personal counseling to “help people gain more clarity in life," a pursuit that has become very important to him. 
Kevin hopes to make U-Strive Coaching a household name synonymous with personal development and professional success. Kevin needs this loan to purchase new materials so that he can expand the services he offers. Additionally, the loan will help Kevin fund new marketing tactics to further grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase new materials such as books and cameras, as well as new marketing materials.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a 32-year-old businesswoman who wants to make progress in her business. She is married and has three school-aged children.  Her family lives happily in the village of La Salette Province of Isabela.  

Dominga makes a living by raising hogs.  She has one mother pig and piglets that she raises in her backyard.  The income from selling some of her hogs helped Dominga open a variety store that provides a daily net income of 300 PHP.  Dominga hopes to have additional capital to improve her new business and maintain her hog-raising business.  

Dominga is requesting to a loan of 15,000 PHP for the maintenance of her hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets for her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 54-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   Ana has a business selling fish in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 15 years.

Ana requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a business selling food in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a variety store.

Epefania requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more ingredients for her food production business.  In the future, Epefania would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and married with two children. With her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

For the past eight years Analyn has run a sari-sari, or general store. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, cream, milk, snack foods, sardines, etc. in her shop.

Analyn has requested a 30,000 PHP loan from NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari. She would like to earn money to cover school fees so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 44 years old.  She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Emelia has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Emelia has requested a loan in the amount of 23,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.  Emelia has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Emelia would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: La Cabañita Group

texts.es:
Doña Consuelo tiene 53 años de edad ella es parte del grupo La Cabañita dice que le pusieron ese nombre a su grupo porque donde hacían sus reuniones era en una cabaña de una de las integrantes y es por eso que le pusieron así. Consuelo tiene un taller de serigrafía desde hace mas de 10 años ahí hace calendarios, agendas, hace carteles, mandan hacer tesis para las personas que se titulan, mandan imprimir playeras, tasas con decorados favoritos de los clientes, también platica que hacen invitaciones para fiestas, folletos etc. Dice que su negocio lo emprendió por que su esposo fue que le enseño a ella a manejar las maquinas para hacer letras, dibujos, bordados etc. Donde tiene su negocio renta ya que en su casa no tiene espacio suficiente para las maquinas, dice que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de tinta, papel, bolsas, calendarios y para darle mantenimiento a las maquinas, dice que le servirá de mucho el crédito por que en estos meses tienen trabajo debido a que le mandan hacer tesis y podrán tener material para hacerlas. 

Ella está casada con el señor Raúl ellos ya no tienen hijos que dependen de ellos ya que todos son mayores de edad. La meta que tiene Consuelo es poder hacer un local en su casa para ya no pagar rentas ya que sale muy caro y tienen perdidas de ganancias. 

Las otras trece personas integrantes del grupo se llaman Leticia, Ma. del Rosario, Florentina, Maribel, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Isabel, Liliana, Reynalda, Sofía, Alejandra ellas invertirán en una tienda de abarrotes, en material para hacer costuras artesanales, frutas y legumbres de temporada, compra de insumos para hacer pan, bisutería, herramientas para taller mecánico, en una pollería y en la compra de zapatos y ropa por catalogo todo para su venta.
texts.en:
Doña Consuelo, 53, belongs to the communal bank "La Cabañita" (The Little Cabin).  The name of the group comes from the fact that its meetings used to be held in a cabin belonging to one of the members.  Consuelo has a silk screen printing workshop which she has been running for ten years.  She makes calendars, agendas, posters, and prints thesis papers, t-shirts or mugs.  She also prints party invitations, brochures, etc.  She claims the business was started by her husband who taughter her how to use the machines to make letters, drawings, embroidery designs, etc.  She rents space for her shop since she does not have room at home for the machines.  The loan she is requesting is to buy ink, paper, bags, calendars and to pay for machine maintenance.  The loan will be very helpful because she has many thesis-printing orders this time of the year and she will be able to obtain the materials she needs for this.

She is married to Raúl and their adult children live independently.  Consuelo's goal is to open a shop in her house so she does not have to pay rent which is expensive and cuts into her profit.

The other 13 members of the group are Leticia, Maria del Rosario, Florentina, Maribel, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Isabel, Liliana, Reynalda, Sofía, and Alejandra.  They will be investing in a grocery store, fabric for sewing crafts, seasonal fruit and vegetable sales, ingredients to make bread, costume jewelry sales, mechanical workshop tools, chicken sales, and catalogue clothing and shoe sales.

loans.use: To buy ink, paper, bags, calendars, and to provide maintenance for silk screen printing machines.

loans.name: Ninosca

texts.es: La señora Ninosca es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es docente desde hace 8 años, según expreso es una profesión muy bonita y que requiere de vocación. El crédito que solicita es de uso personal el cual ocupara para realizarse un chequeo médico y comprar ciertas cosas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ninosca is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has been a teacher for eight years. According to her, she says teaching is a very nice profession and a vocation that requires much from her.

The loan she is requesting is for personal use. It will be used to obtain a medical checkup and to pay for certain items.

loans.use: to pay for a medical checkup and other items.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet is 35 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for her family.  Jannet runs a variety store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years.  She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, and other groceries. 

Jannet requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more products to sell.  In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell at her variety store.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 28 years old and married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines.  Jessica has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Jessica requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more items to sell in her store.  Prior to this loan, she has borrowed and repaid from other loans from NWTF.   Jessica aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 35 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines.   Mary Ann has run the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and farming sugarcane.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell at her store.  Prior to this loan, she has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF.  Mary Ann aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 33 years old.  She is married and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Evangeline is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from selling food.

Evangeline is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con su esposo, tiene dos hijos pero ya están casados, ella se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón, esta venta la inicio como una fuente generadora de dinero, para poder solventar algunas necesidades del hogar, la realiza junto a su esposo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de semilla cruda, esta la venden para ser procesada y puesta a la venta, este préstamo le ayudara para que Blanca tenga de este fruto para seguir procesándola y en la venta.
La aspiración de ella es que a través de su esfuerzo y trabajo pueda mejorar las instalaciones de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her husband. She has two children, but they are already married. Blanca sells cashew nuts. She started this business as a way of generating income to cover some of her household needs. Blanca performs the work with her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy raw cashew nuts that will be processed and sold from her vending post. This loan will help Blanca have the inventory required to continue processing and acquire finished products to sell. Her aspiration is to strive and work toward making improvements to the facilities in her home.

loans.use: to buy raw cashew nuts.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is from the village of Saranay, Cabatuan.  She is 27 years old and married with two children. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for almost three years and earns approximately PHP 250 daily. Through the income generated from her business, Angel has been able to give daily allowances to her children for school.  

Angel requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase grocery items, such as canned goods, assorted biscuits, and basic kitchen items, to sell.  She hopes that she will receive the loan because it will allow her to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as canned goods, assorted biscuits, and basic kitchen items, to sell.

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is 61 years old and married with 7 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Febe runs a boutique in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell. Febe has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as blouses, shirts, and pants.

In the future, Febe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is from Balili, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 57 years old, widowed, and has four children. Nena owns and operates a business making and selling banana cue food (snack food). She has been in her business for four years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more bananas in order to sell more. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina sells grocery products. Her husband, Ferdinand, is a farmer. When it is not cropping season, Marcelina supplements their income with her business selling different products such as snack foods, drinks, and spices. She buys the items from the market and carries them by her motorbike to resell in her village.

Marcelina wants to expand her business by purchasing more items like perfume, beauty goods, and electronic items for resale, so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to increase her capital. Marcelina and her husband have been married since 1995 and they have three grown up children.

loans.use: to buy perfume, beauty goods, and small electronic items for her business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.
