Martha se animo a tener su Peluquería porque los ingresos de su pareja son muy bajos y al ver eso ella tomo la decisión de iniciar su negocio, para sí apoyar más con los gastos del Hogar.

Martha está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar una maquina secadora de cabello así como también materiales como tintes para cabello, gel fijador, laca, entre otros, lo que le permitirá dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y desempeñar su trabajo de mejor manera, así seguirá luchando cada día por cumplir su más grande sueño:” Abrir otra peluquería y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia”.
texts.en:
Martha is 37 years old and lives in the city of Pisco.  The city is known for one of its most important tourist attractions, the Ballestas Islands, and its main activity is fishing.  With her partner she has two little ones, just 9 and 4 years old, whom she loves a lot and to whom she gives her life.  She is very hardworking.  Previously she worked as an assistant in a beauty salon, but with a lot of effort and savings, three years ago she managed to get her beauty salon business.

Martha was inspired to have her beauty salon because her husband's income is very low, and so she decided to start her business to help more with the household expenses.

Martha is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy a hair dryer as well as supplies such as hair dye, hair gel, hairspray, and others, which will allow her to give her customers better service and better perform her job.  In this way she will continue fighting day by day to realize her biggest dream: "To open another beauty salon and give her family a better quality of life."

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, hair dye, hair gel, hairspray, and other things.

loans.name: Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HUAYNA POTOSI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes, que cuentan con una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Margarita. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de pan, venta de comida, venta de gelatina, venta de awayos, venta de carne.

La señora Margarita, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace un año atrás. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta carne, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su Tío. El crédito de este ciclo es para aumentar su capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las comunidades y posteriormente lo comercializará a en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustó el seguro de vida.

En la fotografía no se encuentran la señora Miriam y Gregoria, Miriam por rasones de consulta médica y Gregoria por razones culturales
texts.en:
The community association 'Huayna Potosi' is starting their second loan cycle with 'Pro Mujer' as a part of the 'Centro Focal de Panamericana'. It is made up of ten members and led by a board, which Margarita is the head of. The businesses that the community association members are a part of are varied and include: selling vegetables, selling bread, selling food, selling gelatin, selling awayos (traditional woven cloth) and selling meat.    

Margarita told us that she joined the community association a year ago. She currently has a meat selling business, which she has been working in for years and learned the business from her Uncle. The loan from this cycle she will use to increase her capital to be able to buy cattle which she buys in the communities close by and sells in the markets. This allows her to support her family. She is married and has five children. 

When she was asked what she likes about 'Pro Mujer' she said she likes the life insurance.    

**Not pictured are Miriam and Gregoria, Mirian because she had to go to a medical appointment and Gregoria for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Las Joyas, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Aurelia ; ella tiene  40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 7, 9 años de edad;  La socia  tiene un pequeño stand en unos de los mercadillos por su barrio y la socia vende todo tipo de bazar y multiservicios, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y ha implementando su pequeño negocio con ganchitos , coletas,  la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de mercadería para implementar  su negocio . La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ganchos, coletas, vinchas, peines y otros
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the "Virgen del Carmen" communal bank. The bank is located in the Las Joyas district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Aurelia is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are 13, 7 and 9 years old. She has a small stand in some of the markets in her neighborhood and she sells at all types of stationery and miscellaneous items. She is a very hard-working woman and she has set up a small business with hairpins and ponytails. 

Aurelia wants to invest the loan into buying merchandise in order to set up her business. She is asking for the loan to invest in hairpins, ponytails, hairbands, combs and other items. Aurelia is happy about the loan and she promises to make all of the payments.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise to set up her business

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ángela, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 22, 17 y 12 años de edad que  estudian el mayor en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es ebanista. 

Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el cual tiene un taller de ebanistería en su casa, allí él fabrica muebles de todo tipo, puertas, camas entre otras cosas, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, ella y sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo y mucho más cuando tiene obras por entregar ya que esta es la mejor carta de presentación que él tiene el cumplimiento de sus obras a tiempo.  Lleva más de 10 años dedicado a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar madera, pinturas, lacas, clavos y  otros materiales necesarios para elaborar los muebles. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y responsables.
 
Su sueño es tener un camión para realizar las entregas a domicilio.
texts.en:
The members of Madres Unidas Communal Bank meet every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products such as, for example, the Panama hats known nationally and outside the country.

Here we met Ángela.  She is 45 years old and married, and from this relationship has three children, ages 22, 17, and 12.  The oldest studies in the university and the younger ones are in high school.  Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

She is getting the loan to help her husband, who has a cabinetmaker's workshop in their house, where he makes all types of furniture, doors, beds, and other things.  He works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 until 6:00.  She and her children help him in his work and much more when he has work to deliver, because this is the best recognition he has, fulfilling his work on time.  He has been doing this work for more than ten years and it is going very well for him.

She is going to use this loan to buy wood, paint, shellac, nails, and other supplies necessary to make the furniture.

She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because her associates are very close and responsible.  Her dream is to have a truck to make home deliveries.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, shellac, nails, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children. Violeta has operated a tailoring shop for 6 years, making, repairing and selling school and office uniforms, dresses, curtains and pillow sheets. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy materials needed for the shop. Violeta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en: Emilio is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 7 children. Emilio has operated a shop for 20 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. Emilio has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Emilio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Pelesia

texts.en: Pelesia, 58 years old, is married to Isaiah and they have one child. She sells sacks and empty bags to traders and farmers in the market place in Nakuru. Pelesia plans to use this loan to buy more sack bags to be able to meet her clients’ demands since she has many supply orders from her various customers. In the future, Pelesia hopes to grow her business and supply sack bags to all markets in Nakuru and other neighboring towns.

loans.use: To buy sack bags for sale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Julieta has operated a retail shop for 10 years, buying and selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She also makes and sells viands (cooked meat dishes) such as adobo and afritada.

Julieta has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store and ingredients for making viands. Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store and ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Marites has operated a shop for 2 years, selling fish such as sardines, mackerel and milk fish. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell. Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Jelibeth

texts.en: Jelibeth is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. Jelibeth has operated a shop for 3 years, selling animal feed by the kilogram for pigs and chickens. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy sacks of pig and chicken feed. Jelibeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jelibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of animal feed for pigs and chickens

loans.name: Mara

texts.en: Mara is 30 years old and single. Wanting to help her parents financially, she became engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years. Mara wants to maintain her business but has had insufficient capital for her hogs' feed. Mara decided to take out a loan of PHP 30,000 to continue her business and maintain her supply of feed for the hogs. Mara hopes to succeed in her business so that she may attain her desire of having a continuous source of income.

loans.use: to maintain her supply of feed for the hogs

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Katherine has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for eleven years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Katherine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Evangeline has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of bananas to sell.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Darren

texts.en:
Darren is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell to customers.

Darren has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a jeepney (a small bus) transport business.

Darren has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa tiene 40 años no es casada pero es madre soltera ella tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 12 y 7 años los dos ya se encuentran estudiando. La Sra. Elsa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida  que se encuentra en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la localidad, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elsa utilizara este  préstamo para la compra de un refrigerador e insumos para el negocio la razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, Elsa  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la  competencia y ella quiere destacarse de la competencia ofreciendo un  buen servicio a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ventas y generar mas ingresos, se siente feliz y agradecida por al oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old and is not married. However, she is a single mother of two children who are 12 and 7 years old and who both go to school. Elsa makes a living preparing and selling food. She can be found in one of the most trafficked markets in her area. 

This is her first loan within the institution. Elsa will use the loan to buy a refrigerator and supply for her business. She is requesting the loan because she does not have enough money to get what she needs. 

Elsa has some challenges in her business like competition. She wants to stand out from the rest of the competition by offering good customer service and in that way increase her sales and make a better income. 

She is happy and grateful for the opportunity she has been given.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a widowed farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya, where she lives with her family of six adult children. She has been in farming for over 25 years and says farming has been her livelihood. Her farm produces milk and tea, which she sells locally.

Eliza has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She says the cow will increase her milk production and family income and enable her be self-reliant. She is optimistic that the business will continue to grow, since she has enough skills with both farming and loan repayment.

She adds, however, the challenge remains of drought and poor milk prices within the local market.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 48-year-old widowed lady from Kisumu City. She has four children, ages 22, 23, 25, and 28.

Florence operates a salon, a business she has been running for the last 22 years. She makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings. She is taking out her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy a blow dryer, shampoos, and human hair.

Her anticipated profits will be used to buy more items needed for her salon business. Her dream is to own a hairdressing school.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer, shampoos, and human hair

loans.name: Yolisa

texts.en:
Yolisa is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Yolisa has a shop that sells bananas, spices, and food seasonings. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy bananas, spices, and food seasonings to sell. Yolisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,Yolisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, spices, and food seasonings to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Due to hardship, Veronica aimed to improve her small variety store to supplement her husband's income and support the education of their three children. They agreed to educate all their children so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. She planned to improve her store and increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand.

But due to inadequate capital, she is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional stocks of canned goods, breads, soaps, beverages, and seasonings to sell. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve the business, and she hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, breads, soaps, beverages, and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 34 years old and married with three children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, beans, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, beans, rice, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda is 46 years old and married with three children.  She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running her store for two years and also earns an income from fishing.   She works hard to provide for her family. 

Nelinda requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.  She has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan.  Nelinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 32 years old and is married to Beatrice. He operates a metal and tin shop in Nakuru town, where he makes and sells tin items like tin lamps and boxes, as well as watering cans for farmers.

Benson was introduced by one of the existing clients who had also borrowed and benefited from KADET LTD loans. He plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of metal and tin materials for his business. 

In the future, Benson hopes to grow his business and increase his income and be able to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: buy metal materials

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 2 years and describes her business environment as busy because she is visited regularly by her customers. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Winfred has been able to educate her children.  She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

Winfred has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a hair blower machine and a hair dryer.

loans.use: buy hair drying equipment

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed.  

Lolita has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school and office uniforms, dresses, curtains and pillow cases. She has had this business for 15 years. Lolita requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop.  

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben works hard to support his family. Ruben is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  He has been in this business for 6 years.

Ruben requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in his food stall.   In the future, he would like to save enough money to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 1 child. 

Rolando has a karaoke shop that provides karaoke services where customers pay 5 pesos for every song. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to pay for the electricity for the videoke or karaoke services.

Rolando has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rolando hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: pay for electricity

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco  hijos de 19, 17,  16, 12 y 10 años, tres de sus hijos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer y realiza fletes en su carro.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad  como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. y también ciertos productos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados, los productos los recibe en su local en su gran mayoría y algunos los compra en Manta y Montecristi. Tiene más de seis años con su negocio y  fue con uno de los créditos que empezó con su tienda y  la ha ido mejorando con los créditos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 10 años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products such as, for example, the Panama Hat, which is known all over the world, the members of the communal bank "Madres Unidas" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Ana, who is 38 years old, married and has 5 children aged 19, 17, 16, 12 and 10 years.  Three of her children are in secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school.  All of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a driver, and he provides transportation services with his car.

She has a grocery store in her house where she sells all types of basic consumer products such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, etc.  She also sells some stationery goods.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm, and at times she stays open even later.  Her children and husband help her with her work when they aren't too busy.  She has most of the products delivered to her house, but she buys some of them in Manta and Montecristi.  She has had this business for more than 6 years.  She started her store with one of these loans, and ever since she has been gradually improving it with subsequent loans.

She will use this loan to stock up her store; she is going to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages and other consumer staples.  She has been with her communal bank for more than 10 years, and she likes it because she has made more friends in the group.

Her goals are to continue to make progress with her business, and to see her store grow over time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages and other consumer staples

loans.name: Hiyasmine

texts.en:
As a married mother of 10 children, Hiyasmine works hard to support her family.   

Hiyasmine has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment and to repair her fishing boat.

Hiyasmine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: buy fishing tools/equipment and repair her boat

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Angelina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 6 years.   She is also selling charcoal per sack and bananas per kilogram. 

Angelina requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks for her retail store and materials needed for her charcoal business.  

Angelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: restock her store and buy charcoal materials

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Doña Rosaura  es madre soltera, tiene 39 años de edad, tiene tres hijas que son estudiantes y que aun dependen de su madre. Doña Rosaura se dedica a la venta de tortillas de harina desde hace seis años, el negocio lo aprendió cuando trabajo en una fabrica de elaboración de tortillas. Ella trabaja en conjunto con una de sus hijas, ellas elaboran las tortillas y luego salen a vender, comienzan desde las 5:00 A.M hasta las 5:00 P.M. Una de sus ventajas es que tiene mucha clientela pero se le dificulta andar ambulante sin un medio de transporte ya que tiene que lidiar con los cambios de clima. El préstamo que doña Rosaura solicita es para surtir su negocio en la compra de productos como ser: harina, huevos, sal, manteca, leña, entre otros y para que su lugar de trabajo este en mejores condiciones . El mayor  deseo de doña Rosaura es terminar de construir su casa para ya no seguir alquilando y una de sus metas es poder tener una fábrica de tortillas de harina bien instalada, para así aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Rosaura is a single mother.  She is 39 years old and has three daughters who are students and still depend on their mother.  Doña Rosaura has worked selling flour tortillas for six years.  She learned the business when she worked in a tortilla factory.  She works together with her three daughters.  They make the tortillas and later go out to sell them, beginning at 5:00 a.m. and going to 5:00 p.m.  

One of her advantages is that she has many clients, but it is difficult for her to get around walking without a mode of transport, since she has to struggle with changes in the weather.  The loan that Doña Rosaura is asking for is to supply her business with the purchase of products such as flour, eggs, salt, lard, firewood, and others and improve the condition of her workplace.  

Doña Rosaura's greatest desire is to finish building her house so that she doesn't have to continue renting, and one of her goals is to be able to have a well established factory for flour tortillas in order to increase her earnings and in this way improve the finances of her home.

loans.use: to purchase flour, salt, lard, and other items.

loans.name: Dormelita

texts.en:
This time, for her 16th cycle loan, Dormelita is borrowing PHP 29,000, which she intends to use to buy a new engine for her fishing boat and for repairs. 

This fishing business that Dormelita previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family with increase in their income and improvement in their living conditions.

loans.use: buy a new engine for her fishing boat and for repairs

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en:
Assumpta lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children -- three of them are still in school. 

Assumpta heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 42 years old and married with one child.

Sonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Sonia has borrowed and re-paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Sonia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by hog raising in the Philippines. Gemma is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Gemma has been hog raising for five years and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita admires her neighbor for being hard-working. To make a living, she manages a retail business which sells cosmetic products such as beauty products and fragrances. She has been in her business for five years and wish that she will continue to maintain the business.

Estelita is married to a mechanic and blessed with four children. Through her income and the earnings of her husband, she was able to send her children to school and they were able to finish their degrees.  Estelita wish to continue and improve her business while she can manage it.
 
With regards to the improvement of her business, Estelita is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy lipstick, make-up and fragrances.

loans.use: buy lipstick, make-up and fragrances.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 60 years old, is married, and has one child in school. Adela works very hard to provide for her child.

Adela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products for her store.

Adela has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, medicines, and other groceries. 

In the future, Adela would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and spices for her food production for her business.
Consorcia has been in this business for five years. Consorcia earns more income from raising pigs.

Consorcia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and spices for her food production business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 69 years old and widowed with seven children. Amelita works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Amelita has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 25 years old.  She has a common-law husband and 2 children.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary Ann has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 3 years.  

Mary Ann has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 2 years.

Sheila requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell such as sugar, soap and other groceries.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Maricus

texts.en:
Maricus is a fifty-year-old man from Migori County.  He is married to Clementina and they have six children aged between 12 and 25 years.

Maricus operates a vending business selling a variety of home products like footwear and other items. He has been in this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 25,000.  

Maricus is now taking his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy stocks of footwear and other home products.   His profits will be used to expand the business and also educate his children.  His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: buy footwear and other homep roducts

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year old Remedios is a married woman with four children aged between 13 and 21 years old. Remedios is a fish vendor from Baclayon, Bohol. She has been in this kind of business for 25 years. Remedios is able to buy her family's basic needs with her income.

Remedios has requested a loan to buy ice boxes, salt and more fish to sell. Remedios hopes for her income to improve so she can sustain her children's education. She also hopes for her family to experience a progressive life.

loans.use: to buy ice boxes, salt and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Modesta Narcisa

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Modesta, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero aún viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja de tres a cuatro días a la semana sobre todo en las tardes después de dejar todo listo en su hogar, ella también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes si desean alguna prenda,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la compra en varias ciudades donde consiga más barato y mejor variedad de prendas. Tiene más de 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela que ha ganado con el paso de los años.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva más de 10 años en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta y  le gusta por los beneficios y créditos complementarios que ofrece la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un almacén o una boutique,
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known both inside and outside the country for its great diversity of typical products such as straw hats an shawls, the members of the communal bank Madres Unidas ("Mothers United") gather. 

In this place we meet Modesta.  She is 47 years old, married and by this relationship has two children who are now grown, but who still live in her house.  Her husband is a driver.

In order to earn her own money and with it to help her husband with the household expenses, she works selling clothing of all types.  Her form of sales is door-to-door.  She works three to four days a week, especially in the afternoons after she has left everything ready in her house.  She also sells in her house where her customers come if they want some garment.  She gives credit to her customers and charges them every week.  She buys her merchandise in various cities, wherever she obtains the lowest price or the best variety of garments.  She has done this work for 18 years and it is going very well since she has many customers that she has earned with the passing of the years.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, tee shirts and children's clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years.  She is the president and she likes it for the benefits and the complementary credits that they offer.

Her dream is to have a store or boutique.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, tee shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 40-year-old beauty shop owner in Mombasa. She is married and is a mother of two school-going children. She has been selling cosmetics for the last three years with great success.   

This marks Rehema's first business loan from KADET LTD  to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase more braids, weaves, hair chemicals and hair oils. 

Rehema will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.  She hopes to be self-reliant and be able to support her family.

loans.use: buy braids, weaves, hair chemicals and hair oils

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon is 46 years old and is married with 3 children. With 2 children in school, Maricon works very hard to provide for them.

Maricon runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as detergents, soap, shampoo and other miscellaneous items.  She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

In the future Maricon would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old and is married to Lucy.  They are blessed with four children, aged between 13 and 7 years.  His baking business generates a monthly income of KES 30,000 and he has been in this business for three years.

David will use this loan to purchase baking materials and an oven.  The profits generated will be used to start poultry keeping.  This is his first loan from KADET LTD.  His dream is to buy his family a plot of land.

loans.use: buy baking materials and an oven

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 37 years old, married and has one child. She runs a printing shop to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 11 years and has employed one person. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Virginia has been able to educate her child and she hopes to expand her business in the future.  Virginia has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a printer.

loans.use: buy a printer

loans.name: Armi

texts.en:
Armi is a married woman with seven children. She is 55 years old and has 1 child who is in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Armi has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 8 years. 

Armi requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like soap, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  Armi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 40-year-old man from Migori.  He is married to Akinyi and they have five children, aged between 5 and 13 years.

Paul sells cereals, mostly maize and beans, and has been doing this business for the last four years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is now taking a third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy stocks of maize and beans for resale. 

His profits will be used to better the life of his family through the provision of basic needs.  His dream is to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: buy maize and beans

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children -- three of them are still in school. 

Josephine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her thirds loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of PHP 1500 in order to purchase more charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is an entrepreneur from Baclayon, Bohol. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 children aged between 13 and 21.

Restituta has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. She earns 5000 PHP per month doing this business. Restituta works hard to help her husband feed their family 3 times a day and send their kids to school.  

Restituta applied for a loan to purchase fishing nets, baits and hooks.  She hopes for her business to grow more. She plans to make improvements to their house once her income improves.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, baits and hooks

loans.name: Jessenia Marilyn

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jessenia, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos  de 12, 11 y 6 años de edad, los mismos que estudian el mayor en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella tiene un negocio en su casa en el cual vende pollos a la brasa, esto lo realiza de viernes a domingo, pero los otros días también por las tardes vende pan de almidón y el delicioso morocho, bebida que es muy consumida por sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 16h00 hasta las 21h00, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan. Lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pollos, aliños, morocho y otros  viveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 2 años en el Banco Comunal y  le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que nunca les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known both inside and outside the country for its great diversity of typical products such as straw hats and shawls, the members of the communal bank Madres Unidas ("Mothers United") gather.

Here we encounter Jessenia.  She is 32 years old, is married and has three children of 12, 11, and 6 years old.  The oldest one studies in high school and the younger ones in primary school.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

She has a business in her house where she sells rotisserie chicken.  She does this from Friday to Sunday, but the other days in the afternoons she also sells yuca bread and the delicious morocho, a (corn) beverage much drunk by her customers.  She works every day from 4:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. and her children and husband help her.  She has been doing this for more than 10 years and it is going very well. 

She will use this loan to purchase chickens, seasonings, morocho corn and other supplies to prepare the food.  She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes if for the help that they give with the loans.

Her dream is that her children never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy chickens, seasonings, morocho corn and other supplies.

loans.name: Jenny Argentina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad, ambos  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene un bazar en su casa en el cual además de vender cosas pequeñas  como ropa, zapatos, también vende muebles, colchones, telas para tapizados entre muchos otros artículos más, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, con ella trabaja un muchacho a quien le paga un sueldo mensual y también su esposo le ayuda cuando está desocupado, lleva más de 5 años con su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, ropa y zapatos para surtir su bazar. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.

Su sueño es tener un camión para realizar sus compras y para entregar sus productos.
texts.en:
The members of the Madres Unidas Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi. This city is known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as for example, Panama hats, which are famous both inside and outside of the country.

Here we meet Sra. Jenny, 40, who is married and has two children, 12 and 9 years old. They attend secondary and primary school. Her husband is a merchant.

Jenny has a variety store in her home where, in addition to selling small items such as clothing and shoes, she also sells furniture, mattresses and upholstery fabric among many other products. She works every day from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. A boy works with her whom she pays a monthly salary and also her husband helps her when he is not busy. She has had the business for more than five years.

This loan is to purchase fabric, clothing and shoes to stock her store. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and she likes it because of how quickly one obtains loans.

Her dream is to have a truck to do her shopping and for delivering her goods.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 59-year-old man from Migori county, West of Kenya.  He is married and is a father of eight children, aged between 10 to 30 years.

Andrew is a farmer.  He plants various crops like sweet potatoes and maize in small scale. He has been doing this for the last eight years and makes a monthly income of KES 12,000.  

Andrew is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to plough his farm for planting season.  He will then use the profits to pay school fees for his children.  His dream is to educate all of his children.

loans.use: plough his farm for planting season

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 50-year-old lady from the county of Migori, situated in the Western part of Kenya.  She is married to James and they have six children,  aged 11 to 23 years.

Florence sells clothing and has been involved in this business for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Florence is now taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stocks of clothing for sale.   Her profits will be used to increase her  business stock and also provide basic needs for her family.  She dreams of educating her children.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 37 years old, married, and has one child who is still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase charcoal.   She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in Kator.  She sells alcohol and has been in business for five years. She is 33 years old, married, and has four children -- all of them are still in school. 

Lilian heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 1000 SDG in order to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy beer

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a 45-year-old man from Migori township.  He is married to Kesia, who is a house wife, and they have eight children.

Musa operates a maize cereal business and has been doing this for the last four years, making a monthly income of KES 15,000.  He is taking his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy maize for sale. 

Musa plans to use the anticipated profits to boost his maize stock.  His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old and is married with 5 children, 2 of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in the business for 5 years.

Virginia requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for fishing. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora lives in Kator.  She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 26 years old, married, and has three children -- all of them are still in school. 

Flora heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 800 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Fabianus

texts.en:
Fabianus is 72 years old, married and has 6 children.  He does tailoring to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 53 years and describes his business environment as busy. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Fabianus has been able to educate his children and he hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 33-year-old man from Migori county.  He is married to Caren and they have two children, aged between 6 and 10 years old.  

Joshua runs a retail shop business, a business he has run for the last eight years, making a monthly income of KES 13,680.   He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy stocks of sugar and cooking fat.  

Joshua will use his anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family.  His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: buy sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 37 years old and single. She has 1 child. Rizalina runs a bakery shop in Baclayon, Bohol. She makes the bread herself. She also sells other items like canned goods and softdrinks.  Rizalina earns 7000 PHP per month from her business. She works hard to improve her income and save for her child's education.

Rizalina has requested a loan to purchase ingredients for baking such as flour, sugar, lard and yeast. Rizalina hopes for her loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old, a mother of three children. She is married to Thomas and they come from Migori town, West of Kenya.

Mary operates a retail shop which sells a variety of items like jewelery, ladies shawls and many other items. The business is locally known as mali mali. She has been in the business for the last nine years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD., which she will use to buy stock of jewelery and different types of shawls to sell. Her hope is to see her business grow and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy stock of jewellery and different types of shawls to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Buluk. She sells food stuff and has been in business for four years. She is 28 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC, South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 800 in order to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread to sell.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a 24-year-old man from Migori town.  He is married to Nancy and they have one child. 

Jared operates a retail shop, a business he has been doing for the last two years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is currently taking his first loan cycle from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy stocks of cooking oil and sugar. He will use the profits to buy more products to sell in his shop.

His dream is to own a big retail shop in Migori.

loans.use: buy cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 24 years old, married and has one child. He runs a barber shop to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, John has been able to save his income and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy 2 shaving machines.

loans.use: buy 2 shaving machines

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 32 year old man from Migori County and is married to Evaline. They have two children,  two years and five years of age.

Martin operates a motorcycle transport business, a business he has operated for the last 3 years, making a monthly income of KES 5,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD., which he will use to buy spare parts for the motorcycle. 

His profits will be used to repay the loan. His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 45 years old and married. She has four children.

Raquel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Raquel has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Raquel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 51 years old, a married woman with seven children. Only one of the children is attending school. The rest of her children have settled into marriage. 

In order to meet day-to-day needs, Anastacia established a retail store and has generated a good profit for almost two years now. She usually earns about PHP 3,500 each month to pay towards meals and bills at home. She would like to sell more products so she has decided to avail a loan amounting to PHP 25,000. She will utilize her loan towards buying more grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and breads to sell. These items will help increase her sales and keep improving her profits. 

Someday, she hopes to continue growing as a businesswoman for the betterment of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and breads to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita has been a hog raiser in their village for almost three years. She is 43 years old and has four children. All attend school. She got involved in this kind of business to help lift her family out of poverty. Though she is only generating a minimal income, she was very happy to meet the family's day-to-day needs. 

As of now, she is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy hog feeds and medicines. 

In the future, Angelita would like to keep making better sales from the business and soon achieve success in the field of work she engaged in.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds and medicines

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is operating a sari sari (variety) store in the village where she live with her husband, who is a farmer, and their two young children. Gina is now 24 years old and in need of additional capital so she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to increase the inventory of merchandise she offers. She will buy sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, noodles, and shampoo to sell in her store. These additional items will improve sales capacity, thus increasing her earnings too. 
In the future, Gina would like to keep making better sales from the business and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, noodles and shampoo to sell in her store

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nelly, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 27 y 24 años de edad, ambos  aun viven en su casa a pesar de que la menor ya está casada. Su esposo trabaja en un taller de ebanistería.

Ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende helados, colas, jugos, batidos de frutas y ciertos bocadillos que ella misma prepara, allí mismo también vende tarjetas y realiza recargas telefónicas. Trabaja todos los días, desde hace 15 años tiene su negocio y  ha podido ir de a poco aumentándolo hasta el día de hoy y con el cual a ayudado a su esposo a sacara delante a su familia. 
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar frutas, helados, sodas, tarjetas  telefónicas entre otras cosas  que vende en su local. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. 

Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The village bank Madres Unidas [Mothers United] meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for a wide variety of traditional products such as the straw hats that are locally and internationally known. 

Here we meet Nelly, 46, who is married and has two children, ages 27 and 24. They both live at home, even though the younger is already married. Her husband works in a carpentry workshop. 

She has a small store in her home where she sells ice cream, sodas, juices, fruit smoothies and some snacks that she makes herself. She also sells phone cards and cell phone minutes. She works every day at the business she started 15 years ago. She has been able to increase her business little by little, and it has allowed her to help her husband to take care of their family.

This loan will be used to buy fruit, ice cream, soda, phone cards and other things that she sells in her store. She has been in the village bank since the beginning and likes it because she has made many friends in the group.

Her goal is to continue making progress with her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, ice cream, sodas, phone cards, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Buluk. She sells clothes and has been in business for two years. She is 28 year old, married, and has two children. All of them are still in school. 
Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,500 in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin works hard to support her family. Jasmin is married and has a firewood sales business in the Philippines.

Jasmin requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy firewood to sell.

Jasmin has been in this business for 2 years now and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

In the future, Jasmin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 50 years old and a mother of two children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 15 years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 10,000 to buy sodas, loaves of bread, and milk for sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas, loaves of bread, and milk for sale.

loans.name: María Azucena

texts.es:
La señora María Azucena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella es docente desde hace 24 años actividad que le encanta y cada día desea mejorar para brindar lo mejor de sí para la educación de los niños, niñas y adolescentes, ya que ellos son el futuro. 
El crédito lo necesita para realizar mejoras en su vivienda en especial para introducir aguas negras y mejorar las puertas.
texts.en:
Sra. María Azucena is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She has been a teacher for 24 years and enjoys her job. Each day she desires to provide the best education to boys, girls, and teenagers since they are the future.

She needs a loan to make improvements to her home, especially the installation of a sewage system and repairs to the doors.

loans.use: to install a sewage system and repair the doors.

loans.name: Sofina

texts.en:
Sofina is a 67-year-old widowed lady from Vihiga County. She has 10 grown-up children.

She has been selling maize cereal for the last 22 years. She is currently making a monthly income of 8,400 Kenyan shillings (KES). This is her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to buy stock of dry maize for sale. 

She will use the profits to expand her stock capacity. Her dream is to grow her business through KADET loans.

loans.use: To buy stock of maize cereal.

loans.name: Yunis

texts.en:
Yunis lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in the business for two years. She is 38 years old, married and has one child in school. 

Yunis heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudan pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 11 children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a basket-weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Emma is borrowing 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials needed for her basket-weaving business.
 
Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: Don Augusto, continua laborando como guarda de seguridad, trabajo de mucha entrega y responsabilidad hacia terceras personas. Con este nuevo credito lo que pretende es llevar a cabo la construccion de la viga corona de su casa; en la cual hara uso de los siguientes materiales de construccion: hierro, cemento, piedras, bloques, arena y piedrin. Augusto se complace y agradece a su vez, en ser una de las personas afortunadas  que cuenta con el apoyo de Afodenic y kiva, ya que por medio de sus bajos ingresos nunca habria sido posible verle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Augusto continues working as a security guard, a job of great dedication and responsibility toward other people.

With this new loan what he wants is to build the capping beam of his house, in which he will use the following construction materials: metal, cement, stones, concrete blocks, sand, and gravel.

Augusto takes pleasure in and, in turn, is grateful for being one of the fortunate people who has the support of AFODENIC and Kiva, because with his low income it never would have been possible to make the improvements to his house.

loans.use: to build the capping beam of his house.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos entre las edades de 24 y ocho años de edad, y vive en la aldea El Carmen de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Doña Mercedes tiene una  actividad que le genera ingresos,  es un negocio de venta de verduras el cual lo tiene establecido desde hace 5 años en el mercado local. Ella vende toda clase de verduras frescas. Es una señora muy trabajadora y su esfuerzo por sacar sus hijos adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ha logrado superarse y actualmente cuenta con dos puestos de verduras el cual uno de ellos lo administra su hija. Ella trabaja desde muy temprano para atender a sus clientes.
Ella solicita su primer préstamo de 20,000.00  Lempiras para comprar verduras frescas y  poder ofrecer a sus clientes calidad de producto.
Sus metas en el futuro es comprar su propio solar y poder hacer su casa, para que sus hijos tengan las comodidades que necesitan.
texts.en:
Doña Mercedes is 42 years old, married, and has 7 children between the ages of 8 and 24. She lives in the neighborhood of El Carmen de Taulabe, Comayagua.

Doña Mercedes generates income through her business of selling vegetables that she established five years ago at the local market. She sells all types of fresh vegetables. Mercedes is a hardworking woman and her efforts have enabled her children to move forward and helped her husband with the household expenses. She has been able to succeed and now has two vegetable stands, one of which is managed by her daughter. Mercedes begins her work very early so that she can serve her customers.

She is requesting her first loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL so that she can buy fresh vegetables. This will allow her to offer high-quality products to her customers. Her goals for the future are to buy her own land and build a house so that her children will have the necessary comforts.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba est une femme mariée qui vend des habits, des chaussures et de l'encens depuis 2 ans. Elle a démarré l'activité sur un financement de 100000f de son frère.Actuellement , elle se fait confectionner des habits par des tailleurs de sa ville et exporte ses produits en Gambie.Cette activité génère des revenus assez interagissants qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de soutenir sa famille. Elle sollicite un pret de 400 000 f pour acheter des tissus et des chaussures. Son ambition est de construire son propre atelier.
texts.en: Coumba is married and has been selling clothes, shoes and incense for two years.  She started her business with an initial funding of 100,000 francs, received from her brother.  She currently orders clothes from local tailors and then exports her products to Gambia. This activity allows her to earn enough to provide for herself and to help support her family.  She is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for the purchase of fabrics and shoes.  Her ambition is to open her own workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes

loans.name: Shehab

texts.en:
Shehab is 28 years old and a married man who has been living in Sana`a, Yemen. He earns a livelihood by being involved in a stationery business which has been in operation  for many years.

His story began with his own initiative. He roamed the streets selling small stationery products such as books, pens and newspapers.  He did all of the work himself, with no set hours and he had some difficulties to overcome. With the passage of days, he was able to open his own stationery store.

In order to stabilize this business and compete against other entrepreneurs doing the same business, he needs sufficient funds to refill his stock of merchandise to continually operate his business smoothly. Consequently, Shehab decided to take out a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase books,gifts and other stationary items to maintain and satisfy his customers.

Shehab hopes that he’ll develop his business successfully in the following years and he’ll be able to expand it and have it become larger.

loans.use: to purchase books,gifts and other stationary items to maintain and satisfy for his customers.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila es socia de del Banco Comunal Universo, se dedica a la venta de golosinas en un terminal terrestre, es madre de 4 hijos, y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 9 años, recuerda que empezó con $50.00, siempre recuerda los consejos de Morenita (Fundadora de FINCA Perú) que le ayudaron para poder salir adelante, con sus enseñanzas las mujeres aprendieron a trabajar y a ser autosuficientes, todo lo que podía aprender lo enseñaba a sus hijos, manifiesta que su agradecimiento a Finca es grande, jamás se retirará de su Banco Comunal porque es como su casa, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas.
texts.en: Cirila is a member of the communal bank Universo. She makes a living selling sweets at a bus station. She is mother to four children and has been a member of Finca Peru for the past 9 years. She remembers starting with $50. She always remembers the advice of Morenita (the founder of FINCA Peru) who helped her get ahead. With her teachings the women learnt to work and to be self sufficient. Everything they could learn they taught to their own children. She claims that her gratitud to Finca is very large. She will never leave her communal bank as it is like home to her. Now, with this loan she will invest in buying sweets.

loans.use: to buy sweets wholesale

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 24 years old and single.

Joan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety/convenience) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Joan has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Joan aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Jelida

texts.en:
Jelida is a 75-year-old widow from the Gambogi area of Vihiga. All of her children are grownups.

Jelida is a tailor. She has been doing this business for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase textile materials. Her profits will be used to repay the loan.

Her dream is to grow her business through KADET loaning.

loans.use: To purchase textile materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en: Leonidas, who works hard to support her family, is married and has been selling coconut wine in the Philippines for three years. Leonidas is requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut wine to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús es socio de del Banco Comunal Universo, es socio de FINCA Perú desde hace un año. Tiene una Moto Taxi y trabaja haciendo movilidad, el cada día se esfuerza para poder ahorrar para comprarse su terreno, él en Finca pudo aprender mucho acerca de cómo hacer un buen negocio, y ser responsable en el trabajo como en su casa, las capacitaciones le ayudan para el futuro con una buena familia, desea poder progresar, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para la moto.
texts.en: Jesús is a member of the communal bank Universo and has been a member of Finca Peru for the past year. He has a motorcycle taxi and works offering a transport service. Every day he makes an effort to save in order to buy himself a plot of land. At FINCA he was able to learn a lot about how to run a successful business and be responsible both at work and in the home. The loans help him to prepare for a future with a good family. He wants to progress. Now, with this loan he will invest in buying spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora es socia de del Banco Comunal Universo, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, es madre de 4 hijos, ella ingresó a Finca Perú hace 15 años en el Banco Comunal Rosario, con  $2.00 desde la fecha no se va porque Finca se convirtió como su casa, ella se distrae y tiene una buena relación con sus compañeras del Banquito, ella salió adelante sola, no recibía la ayuda de su esposo, con los préstamos que sacaba pudo comprar maquinarias para la carpintería que tenía su esposo, aunque no valoran el esfuerzo que hace, ella sigue adelante, las capacitaciones que recibe en Finca le ayudan a poder ser más fuerte y no desmayar. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas para poder tener más surtido.
texts.en: Teodora is a member of the communal bank Universo. She makes a living selling sweets. She is mother to four children and became a member of Finca Peru 15 years ago in the communal bank Rosario, with $2. Since then she doesn't leave as it is like home to her. She forgets hers troubles and has a good relationship with the other members of the bank. She got ahead alone, as she didn't have the support of her husband. With the loans that she was given she was able to buy machines for the carpentry business her husband ran. Although her efforts were in valued she continued getting along. The loans she receives in Finca help her to be stronger and not give up. Now, with this loan she will invest in buying sweets in order to have a greater variety of stock.

loans.use: to buy sweets wholesale.

loans.name: Kissie

texts.en:
Kissie is 32 years old and single. She has one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Kissie has a food-production business in the Philippines. Kissie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Kissie has been in this business for one year. Kissie would like to save enough money to expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: For her third loan, Susan is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund her food-production business. This business was previously funded through NWTF. KIVA continues to provide Susan and her family with funding that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas es socia de del Banco Comunal Covadonga, tiene una Bodega, ella es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años, y pudo aprender en poco tiempo muchas cosas, acerca de como hacer un buen negocio, ella agradece mucho eso porque las cosas le van mejor, su negocio está progresando, y el ahorro le ayuda a poder trazarse metas y poder cumplirlas, también le enseñan como educar a sus hijos, todo lo que aprende en Finca le ayuda a ser mejor persona. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en: Felicitas is a member of the communal bank Covadonga. She has a store and has been a member with Finca Peru for the past five years. She has been able to learn a lot of things about how to run a successful business. She is very grateful as things are going better for her, her business is progressing and her savings help her to be able to plan goals and fulfil them. They also show her her to educate her children. Everything she learns at Finca helps her to be a better person. Now, with this loan she will invest in buying groceries.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emelie is 42 years old.

Emelie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Emelie has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Emelie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Emelie would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Entesar

texts.en:
Entesar is a 38-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan, and a mother of two children.

Entesar is looking to improve her family's life conditions. Thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase new furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her home.

loans.name: Khalfa

texts.en:
Khalfa is a conservative person, so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The person in the photo is her son, Wesam.

Khalfa is a 54-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan, and a mother of five children.

Khalfa is looking to improve her family's life conditions. Thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to do maintenance for her house.

Khalfa is looking to renew her house furniture in the future.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her house.

loans.name: Raniah

texts.en:
Raniah is a 36-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of four children.

Raniah does embroidery in her home. She is talented and experienced and took several training courses to improve her work.

Raniah is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase materials needed in making embroidery.

Raniah is looking to establish her own shop and train other woman on handicrafts.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in embroidering.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a conserve person, so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her husband, Husni.

Nour is a 30-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan, and a mother of four children.

Nour has a grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to purchase more goods for her store.

Nour is looking to improve her family's life conditions and increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her store.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 46-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Najah is selling clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Najah is looking to establish a shop for her business so that she can increase her income and her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo, trabaja como mecánico automotriz  y tiene su taller propio, realiza todo tipo de arreglos en vehículos.
El crédito lo requiere para la ampliación de su garaje para tener más comodidad y atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta forma obtener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Teofilo, es casado y tiene seis hijos con los cuales vive en la zona La Merced ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Teofilo works as an auto mechanic, and he has his own shop.  He does all types of repairs on vehicles.

The loan that he needs is to expand his garage.  He will do this to make it more comfortable and to be able to better serve his customers.  This way he will get more income in order to help his family.

Teofilo is married and has six children.  He lives with them in the La Merced zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the second time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to expand his garage to use it as part of his auto mechanic shop, to make it more comfortable, and to serve more customers.

loans.name: Maria
