texts.es:
Maria, trabaja como enfermera en una entidad pública en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de las gradas en su vivienda para dar más seguridad a sus hijos.
Ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria works as a nurse in a public entity in the city of La Paz.

The loan that she needs is to repair the steps at her house in order to make it safer for her children.  She is single and has three children.  They live in her parents’ house in the Pasankeri zone in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to repair the steps at her house to make it safer for her family.

loans.name: Nashrawan

texts.en:
Nashrawan is conservative person, so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her son.

Nashrawan is a 49-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of  five children.

Nashrawan sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes.

Nashrawan is looking to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Hayfa

texts.en:
Hayfa is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her brother.

Hayfa is a 33-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan, and a mother of two children.

Hayfa is a proud owner of a home-based grocery store. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more goods for her store.

Hayfa is looking to expand her store and improve her family's life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her store.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, se dedica a la producción de leche  y también trabaja con una empresa privada ayudando en la apertura de hoyos para la plantación de postes de energía.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para obtener mas producción de leche y por ende ingresos y de esta forma ayudar a su familia.
Julio, es casado y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la comunidad de  Achacachi  que  se encuentra ubicada dentro del departamento de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julio devotes himself to milk production.  He also works with a private company helping to open holes to place electrical poles.

The loan he needs is to buy a pair of dairy cows in order to get more milk production.  He will do this to get more income and to help his family.

Julio is married and has two children.  He lives in the Achacachi community in the La Paz department.

This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows in order to get more milk production.

loans.name: Yuris Maria

texts.es: Yuris tiene 27 años de edad  y vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 8 a 11 años. Ella y su cónyuge decidieron mejorar su situación económica con el montaje de un negocio, pues este último, había quedado desempleado y por consiguiente sin ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Fue así como se dedicaron a  comercializar metales, papel cartón, plásticos, con poco capital y con un pequeño local donde almacenar el material reciclado. Con su negocio empezó a irles bien, porque invirtieron parte de sus ganancias  en el mismo negocio;  ahora su microempresa cada día crece más y exige un capital de trabajo constante con el cual comprar. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará metales, plásticos, cartón y papel reciclado para lograr una mayor comercialización y un mejor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Yuris is 27 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her partner and their three children aged between 8 and 11. Her partner and her decided to improve their financial situation by setting up a business. Her partner had become unemployed and so did not have any source of income for the family. This is how they came to sell metals, cardboard, plastics; with a little capital and a small storeroom to keep their recycled material.

With this business things started to go well for them as they invested part of their earnings back into the business. Now their micro-business grows more everyday and they need a constant working capital in order to buy materials. This is the reason why they have come to Credikiva, for their first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this they will buy metals, plastics, cardboard and recycled paper in order to achieve more extensive sales and a better income for their family.

loans.use: to buy metals, plastics, cardboard and recycled paper.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 46-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 months to 16 years. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located at a market place and his primary customers are women and men. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortages of charcoal, especially during rainy season. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Patrick's business goal is to run a bigger retail charcoal selling business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 54-year-old widowed lady from Vihiga County and has three grown children.

Ruth does dairy farming, a business activity she has been doing for the last 12 years making a monthly income of 9,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy dairy meal. Her profits will be used to repay the loan.

Her dream is to grow her business through KADET loans.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Ma.fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines. Ma. Fe has been in this business for 10 years now and also earns additional income from a variety store.

Ma. Fe requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Ma.lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ma. Lourdes works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more pants, blouses, curtains and other RTW products.

Ma. Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy more pants, blouses, curtains and other RTW products.

loans.name: Leidy Yamileth

texts.es:
Leydi, es comerciante de frutas y verduras, es madre de una niña de 6 años de edad, vive con su esposo, ella tiene seis meses de haber iniciado el negocio, lo instalo con el apoyo de su esposo, como una iniciativa para tener ingresos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frutas frescas como papayas, mangos, manzanas, piña, con este lograra mejorar y fortalecer el negocio para aumentar las ganancias.
Su objetivo es mejorar económicamente, para poder tener una condición más estable junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Leidy sells fruit and vegetables. She is mother to a six year old girl and lives with her husband. She started her business six months ago, with the support of her husband, as an initiative to obtain income.

She is requesting a loan to buy fresh fruits such as papayas, mangoes, apples and pineapples. With this she will improve and strengthen her business in order to increase profits.

Her objective is to improve economically to be able to have a more stable situation together with her family.

loans.use: to buy papayas, mangoes, apples, pineapples.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, es comerciante de ropa y medicinas, este negocio lo inicio por cuenta propia, quiso instalar un negocio para mantenerse ocupada y generar ingresos para su familia, no tiene un horario establecido ya que lo realiza de forma ambulante.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva  en blusas, ropa interior, camisas, ropa de niños, esta compra le permitirá mejorar y crecer en el negocio, ampliándose para atender nuevas zonas.
La aspiración de María en su negocio es darle mayor crecimiento, poder mejorar los ingresos a la familia y cancelar bien este préstamo.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and two children. She sells clothes and medicines. She started this business on her own as she wanted to install a business in order to keep busy and generate income for her family. She doesn't have an established timetable as she is a street vendor.

She is requesting this loan to buy new clothes such as blouses, underwear, shirts and children's clothing. This will allow her to improve and extend her business, letting her attend new areas.

María's dream is that her business grows in order to improve the family income and repay this loan.

loans.use: to buy blouses, underwear, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius, a 31-year-old married father of one, has run a pharmacy to earn a living for the past two years, and has one employee. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income, and hopes to expand his business in the future. Julius is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more medicines to sell.

loans.use: to buy medicines to sell.

loans.name: Ma.asuncion

texts.en: Ma. Asuncion, who is single, works hard to support her family. A seller of fruits and vegetables in the Philippines for three years now, she is requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell at her stall. In the future, Ma. Asuncion would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a conservative person and is unwilling to upload her picture to the Internet, thus the man in the photo is her husband, Majed. 

Amani is 39 years old and is from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and is a mother of two children. She is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to pay for her son's university education.

loans.use: To cover her son's education fees

loans.name: Imad Al Dein

texts.en:
Imad Al Dein is a 36-year-old married man from Marka Amman, Jordan and a father of three children. 

Imad Al Dein has a metal shop for making aluminum kitchens, thus he is requesting a loan of 1500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase materials and equipment needed for expansion purposes. 

Imad Al Dein is looking to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing more materials and equipment

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. Margie is single and has a candle making business in the Philippines.

Margie requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy wax, wicks and other materials.  Margie has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Margie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wax, wicks and other materials

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amalia is 48 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Amalia has a general store business in the Philippines. Amalia requested a 29,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more goods like soap, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Amalia would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods like soap, canned goods and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 to 14 years. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

She operates a food stall where she sells french fries. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low bargaining power with customers.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more potatoes for preparing french fries for selling. Lydia's business goal is to run a bigger food stall within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for preparing french fries

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco, esta casado y tiene dos hijos, desde hace seis años comenzó su negocio de Venta de Helados como ser, paletas, conos de varios sabores, el vende de manera ambulante en las colonias y barrios de Choluteca desde muy temprano sale a vender,  comenzó con una carreta y luego le pareció que era un buen negocio  y le generaba ganancias entonces decidió alquilar otra para ponerla a trabajar  y ahora tiene las dos, el clima en la ciudad de Choluteca es caliente y eso le favorece porque siempre tiene muchos clientes. Gracias a los ingresos recibidos de su negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia. Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 6,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de paletas, conos, vasitos y mas.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and has two children. He started his business selling ice-creams six years ago, selling ice lollies and different flavoured cones. He sells as a street vendor in the colonies and neighbourhoods of Choluteca. He starts selling very early in the morning. He started of with one cart and then he thought that it was a good business which gave him profits so he decided to rent another cart to put to work and now he has two. 

The climate in the city of Choluteca is hot and this favours him as he always has many customers. Thanks to the income his business received he has managed to maintain his family. He is requesting a loan of 6,000 HNL to invest in buying ice lollies, cones, cups and other items.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ice lollies and ice cream cones for his business.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 42-year-old married woman from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan and a mother of four. She is a conservative person and is unwilling to upload her picture to the Internet, thus the man in the photo is her husband. 

Jameela has a grocery store which she started years ago as a home-based store, then with her hard work she improved it into a licensed store. 

Now, Jameela is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more goods for it. 

Jameela is looking to expand her store and add a refrigerator for frozen food.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Naeema

texts.en:
Naeema is a 51-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of five children.  She is a conservative person and is unwilling to upload her picture to the Internet, thus the man in the photo is her son.

Naeema is looking to improve her family's living conditions, thus she is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do maintenance for her home. 

She wants to renew her home furniture.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a 62-year-old widowed lady from Kakamega town in the west of Kenya. She has six grownup children.

Jecinta operates a general stores where she deals in a variety of household items like saucepans, basins, buckets and other items, a business she has been doing for the last three years making a monthly income of 35,000 KES. 

She is taking her second loan from KADET Ltd  which she will use to buy retail stock like saucepans, basins, jugs and thermoses to sell. She will use anticipated profits to add more retail stock. Her dream is to own a big business premise.

loans.use: to buy more saucepans, basins, jugs and thermoses

loans.name: Turuhuke/ Isngn Group

texts.fr:
Bonaventure fait partie du groupe Turuhuke/Isngn. Il a 30 ans et il est marié, avec 4 enfants de 4 ans à 10 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Bonaventure est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter, des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilise des semences de race améliore. Dans les prochaines années, Bonaventure voudrait être un grand agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bonaventure is a member of the group Turuhuke/Isngn. He is 30 years old, married and the father of four children aged 4 to 10, two of whom attend school. He himself attended 6 years of primary school. 

Bonaventure is a farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he will use the funds to buy fertilizers and pay the labor costs. 

His business growth strategy is to use an improved breed of seeds. In the coming years, he wants to become one of the great farmers in his region. He will use his profits to provide for his children’s tuition and improve his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the labor costs.

loans.name: Alcira Caicedo Padilla

texts.es: Alcira de 56 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 19 a 25 años, ella cundo conformó su familia, decidió buscar una actividad independiente que le diera suficientes ingresos, con los cuales apoyar el bienestar de su hogar; fue así como emprendió su aventura de negocios con una tienda, ubicada en una habitación de su casa, la cual remplazó gradualmente porque le quitaba mucho tiempo para la atención de su hogar. Así mismo  con el ingreso de dinero, producto de su trabajo, compró mercancía variada y en la sala de su casa ubicó una pequeña miscelánea. Negocio que realizara, de manera simultánea a sus tareas hogareñas y especialmente compaginadas con la atención de sus hijos y su esposo. Su negocio ha ido gradualmente creciendo, gracias a su gran capacidad de trabajo, disciplina, responsabilidad y al fortalecimiento que ha hecho la fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha tenido 21 financiamientos durante 7 años. Con ellos logró capitalizar su negocio y con sus utilidades producidas ha adecuado su vivienda poco a poco. En sus negocios vende principalmente de contado, aunque tiene una cartera de crédito que rota cada 40 días. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, financiamiento # 22, con el cual comprará mercancía variada, con ella  surtirá mucho mas su negocio, ajustándolo a la época. Su inversión será exitosa porque tiene una gran experiencia sobre lo que debe vender en cada temporada y especialmente a quien venderle a crédito, fomentando así la sostenibilidad de su microempresa.
texts.en:
Alcira is 56 years old and lives with her husband. She has four children aged between 19 and 25 years of age. When she formed her family she decided to look for an independent activity which would give her enough income to support the welfare of her house. That is how she started her business adventure with a shop, located in a room of her house. This was gradually replaces as it took up too much time which she couldn't dedicate to her home. So, with the monetary income, a product of her work, she bought varied stock and set up a miscellaneous store in the room of her house. She carries out this business as well as complying with the household duties and always attending her children and her husband.

Her business has gradually grown, thanks to her great work capacity, discipline, responsibility and the support of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization which has provided her with 21 loans over 7 years. With these loans she has managed to capitalize her business and with her profits she has improved her residence little by little. In her business she mostly sells up front although she has a credit portfolio which she collects every 40 days.

Presently she is applying for her first Credikiva, loan number 22. With this loan she will buy varied items which will allow her to increase her range of stock, according to the season. Her investment will be successful because she has a lot of experience about what sells in each season and especially who she can sell on credit to, encouraging the sustainability of her micro-business.

loans.use: to buy varied stock; perfumes, clothes, footwear, etc.

loans.name: Laafilabumb De Yagma Group

texts.fr:
Mme COLETTE est la représentante du groupe LAAFI LA BOUMB DE YAGMA. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des plats en plastique. Elle exerce ce métier depuis  03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de Sankaryaaré et au marché de Toecin. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter  01 douzaine de gobelet et 01 douzaine de plats bols.

Elle  épargne  ses bénéfices  pour ses enfants. Mme ambitionne agrandir  son activité de commerce et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. COLETTE is the representative of the group LAAFI LA BOUMB DE YAGMA. She is married and the mother of two dependent children aged 2 and 5, one of whom goes to school. 

Mrs. Colette has been selling plastic wares for the past three years. She buys her merchandise at the markets of Sankaryaaré and Toecin. Her customer base consists of both men and women. 

Mrs. Colette wants to buy one dozen cups and one dozen plates and bowls. 

She is saving her profits for her children. She plans to expand her business and better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy one dozen cups and one dozen plates and bowls for resale.

loans.name: Genesis Islena

texts.es: Genesis es una joven de 22 años que tiene un hijo de 4 años y es el motor de su vida, para él trabaja y sueña con  fomentarle un futuro exitoso. Ella inició estudiando peluquería una vez terminó su bachillerato y cuando finalizó su estudio técnico en este oficio,  empezó a practicar lo aprendido con sus vecinas, poco a poco se perfeccionó, fue extendiéndose su imagen de calidad  en la técnica y en el servicio y así mismo fue construyendo una clientela fiel. Al pasar el tiempo invirtió en mercancía variada, la cual aun vende a crédito y esta actividad complementaria la hizo crecer aun más. Hoy sus planes de ensanchamiento no se detienen; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos de peluquería como productos capilares para el cabello, masajes, tintes y ropa que tiene encargada, lo cual supone de una inversión exitosa porque se ajustará a los pedidos hechos por sus clientes, por quienes se esfuerza en complacerlos, para que su negocio crezca cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Genesis is a 22-year-old woman with a 4-year-old son who is the motor of her life. She works for him and dreams of creating a successful future for him. Right after graduating from high school she enrolled in beauty school and upon ending this technical training she started practicing with her neighbors. Little by little she perfected her technique and her reputation of good quality and service expanded, so she was able to have a loyal clientele base. In time, she invested in diverse merchandise, which she still sells on credit. This supplementary activity helped her expand even more. 
Today, her plans for growing don't stop and she is resorting to her credikiva, the first loan she'll obtain with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, for purchasing some beauty salon products such as hair treatments, dying and coloring products, as well as clothing items she will sell on request. She expects this to be a successful investment because it will respond to the demands and requests of her customers, who she tries to please in order to make her business grow more every time.

loans.use: to purchase beauty salon products such as hair treatments, dyes and clothing

loans.name: Mayra Janeth

texts.es:
Mayra, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, administra una tienda de productos domésticos, este negocio lo aprendió de los suegros, quienes le apoyaron para que instalara su propio negocio, que hasta hoy ha sido su fuente de ingresos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir el negocio, como pastas, embutidos, huevos, condimentos, aceite, este le ayudara para mantener las ventas y la preferencia de los clientes.
Ella quiere mantenerse en el negocio, atrayendo a los clientes y realizando más utilidades.
texts.en:
Mayra lives with her husband and two children. She runs a small home products shop. She learned this business from her husband's parents who helped her start her own shop, which has been her source of income until today. 
Mayra is asking for this loan in order to buy basic staples such as pastas, deli meats, eggs and spices, in order to stock her business, keep her selling volume and continue to be preferred by her customers. She wants to stay in business attracting more customers and obtaining greater profits.

loans.use: to purchase pasta, del meats, eggs, spices, oil

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, es rentista y trabaja realizando tramites para personas particulares de forma independiente; de esa forma obtiene ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena, etc., para la refacción de su vivienda  para dar comodidad  y seguridad a su familia.
Javier, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, viven en casa propia en la zona Tacagua ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la tercera junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Javier receives a pension.  He works completing paperwork for people.  He works in an independent manner, and that is how he gets income to help his family. 

He needs the loan to buy cement, bricks, and sand, etc. to repair his home.  He wants to do this to make his family comfortable and safe.

Javier is married and has four children.  They live in their own house in the Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz.  

This is the fourth time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the third time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and sand, etc. to repair his home

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Angelina heard about BRAC, South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500  SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Wilkista

texts.en:
Wilkista is a 30 year old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Robert and they have two children, aged 12 and three years.

Wilkista sells second hand clothing, a business she been doing for the last three years, making a monthly income of KES 5,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD., which she will use to buy a bale of second hand clothes to sell.

Her profits will be used to buy a piece of land to build a family house. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children; three of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Munga

texts.en:
Munga is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be jovial and deligent. 

Munga operates a retail store where he sells items such as sodas, flour, rice, blue band, stationery. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. His business is located along a busy tarmac road and his primary customers are students. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy home products. Munga's dream and business goal is to run a wholesale business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more home products.

loans.name: Bornnes Matere

texts.en:
Bornnes is 27 years old and married to Everlyne. They are blessed with seven children. He owns a shop, a business he has been doing for the past 10 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is requesting for a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase more crates of sodas, bales of baking flour as well as maize flour. 

Profit he earns from the proceeds of this loan will be ploughed back into his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of sodas, bales of baking flour as well as maize flour.

loans.name: Dosti

texts.ru: Дости трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 6 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. В бизнесе помогают сын, дочь и супруга и они вместе дружно работают. Дости запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов. Дости надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Dosti is a hard-working and conscientious person. He is married and bringing up three children. He has been growing produce for over six years. His son, daughter and wife help him in his business, and they all work together as a team. Dosti is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides. Dosti is hoping for your kind help.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel, se dedica a la carpintería realizando todo tipo de trabajos en madera y cuenta con su propio taller.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de madera con lo cual realizara  trabajos que ya tiene contratados y obtendrá mejores  ingresos para su familia.
Ángel, es casado y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en la zona Villa Dolores la misma ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Es la quinta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Ángel is a carpenter.  He does all types of work with wood, and he has his own shop.

He needs the loan to buy wood, which he will use to do the jobs that have already been ordered.  He will then get better income for his family.

Ángel is married and has one child.  They live in the Villa Dolores zone in the city of El Alto.

This is the fifth time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is his first time working with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood to do the jobs that have already been ordered.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria, se dedica  a la venta de ropa y otros artículos de acuerdo con los días festivos, no cuenta con puesto fijo y por eso ambula por las calles.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería para la festividad del carnaval (disfraces, serpentinas, etc.), para poder vender y lograr ingresos, ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para mantener a su familia.
Gloria es soltera y tiene dos hijos, viven en casa alquilada en la zona Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Gloria sells clothes and other items according to the holidays.  She has no fixed sales location, and therefore works as a street-vendor.

The loan that she needs is to buy merchandise for the Carnaval festivities (costumes and streamers, etc.).  She will do this so that she will be able to sell the merchandise and get income.  This is the only source of work that she has to support her family.

Gloria is single and has two children.  They live in a rented house in the Obispo Bosque zone in the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Carnaval festivities so that she can sell them and improve her income.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  He is from Kisumu City.  Kennedy operates a music and movies disc selling business, which he has been doing for five years.  He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Kennedy is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more music and movie discs to sell.  He will use the expected profits to repay his loan. His dream is to own a big business.

loans.use: to purchase more music and movie discs.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  She is from Kisumu City.  Celestine operates a retail shop, which she has been doing for one year.  She earns a monthly income of  8,000 KES. 

Celestine is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy sugar and cooking fat to sell. She will use her profits to diversify to a boutique business.  Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old, married and has four children.  His spouse rears chickens on their farm.  John is a dairy farmer, which he has been doing for over 10 years.  He earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

John is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD for KES 70,000 after he repaid his previous loans successfully.  He will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow for 45,000 KES and the balance to improve the farm structures.  John will use the profits to repay the loan and put money into his farm.  He hopes to rear more dairy animals and improve the dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and improve the farm.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es: Maritza de 30 años vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 7 a 15 años. Cuando Maritza quedó embarazada de su primer hijo con solo 15 años, para lograr mantenerlo, recibió la propuesta de su padre de vender mercancía puerta a puerta; así fue como empezó generando ingresos con la tutoría de él; poco a poco logro reunir su propio capital y fue independizándose, emprendiendo su propia aventura de negocios, con los cuales aun apoya el sostenimiento de hoy sus 4 hijos. Maritza tiene muchos sueños de crecimiento empresarial, pero su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, en comparación con el tamaño de sus sueños. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancías variadas, como calcetines masculinos y suéteres, los cuales tiene encargados por sus fieles clientes, a quienes quiere complacer,  con el fin de fidelizarlos y este es justamente su gran desafío. Su sueño mas adelante es lograr incrementar su capital de trabajo, para adecuar su negocio y brindar un ambiente confortable a sus clientes, cuando busquen las mercancías que requieren en el negocio de Maritza.
texts.en:
Maritza, 30, lives with her husband and 4 children ages 7 to 15. When she got pregnant with her first son at 15, her father suggested to sell door-to-door products in order to provide for her son. She started generating income with the guidance of her father. Little by little she put together some money to become independent and started her own entrepreneurial adventure which today supports her four children. 
Maritza has many dreams for making her business grow but her working capital is not enough compared to the size of her dreams. That is the reason why she resorts to credikiva, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy diverse merchandise such as men's socks and sweaters that have been requested by her loyal customers, who she wants to please in order to secure their loyalty, which is exactly her greatest challenge. Her dreams for the future are to increase her working capital in order to arrange her shop and offer a comfortable space to her customers whenever they come looking for the products they need from Maritza's business.

loans.use: to purchase diverse merchandise such as men's socks and sweaters

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, el negocio lo inicio hace 30 años junto con su esposo, lo atienden todos los días de la semana.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar mercadería como maíz, frijoles, jabón, detergentes, y de esa forma lograra aumentar el inventario y surtirá mejor su negocio.
El objetivo de Rita es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecerles mejor atención a sus clientes ya que esto le permitira ganar mas por sus ventas y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Rita lives with her husband and children.  She runs a grocery store selling basic staple items, a business she started 30 years ago with her husband; they are open every day of the week.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like corn, beans, soap and detergent to increase stock inventory and better stock her store.  Rita's objective is to strengthen the business and offer better service to her customers since this will allow her to earn more from her sales and provide the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Moises Isaias

texts.es:
Moisés, vive con su esposa y una niña de 4 años de edad, él se dedica a atender el taller de estructuras metálicas, trabaja todos los días, ya tiene un buen número de clientes.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tubos, polines, alicates y otros materiales para la mejora del taller, con este préstamo contara con lo necesario para que el servicio a sus clientes sea de calidad.
Él aspira tener un taller rentable, con muchos clientes, tambien mejorar la calidad de su trabajo, de esta manera garantizar a su familia lo necesario para subsistir.
texts.en: Moisés lives with his wife and four-year-old little girl; he runs a metal structure shop.  He works every day and has a good number of customers.  He is requesting a loan at present to buy tubes, rollers, clippers and other supplies to improve the workshop.  With this loan he will have on hand everything he needs to provide quality customer service.  He hopes to have a profitable shop with many customers and also to improve the quality of his work thus insuring that his family will have what's needed to subsist.

loans.use: to buy tubes, rollers and clippers.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, vive en casa propia, con una hija de 18 años de edad, ella es ama de casa y practica la agricultura, tiene 20 años en esta actividad, paga mano de obra para realizar la labor más pesada, además que siempre necesita ayuda.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada y pago de mozos, con este préstamo podrá tener la disponibilidad económica para mantener lo necesario en la producción agrícola.
La aspiración de María es realizar la siembra de la mejor manera, con la ayuda de este préstamo, además de que quiere apoyar a su hija en la educación para que pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own house with an 18-year-old daughter. Maria is head of the household and practices agriculture, having done so for 20 years. She hires workers to carry out the heaviest labor and often needs such help.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy manure, herbicides, improved seeds and, also, to pay the workers. With this loan she will have the economic means to accomplish what is necessary for her agricultural production.

Maria's aspirations are to accomplish crop planting in a better manner, with the aid of this loan, and she want to pay for educational expenses so that her daughter can get ahead.

loans.use: buy manure, herbicides, improved seeds, and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika forma parte del Banco comunal “Los Conquistadores” perteneciente a la comuna de Puente Alto, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica a la realización de artesanía en tejido, pintura y decoupage (Se trata de una técnica manual decorativa en la que se emplean papeles impresos o telas para pegar sobre soportes varios como madera, género, cerámicos, metales, velas, jabones, vidrios, lozas y cartón entre otros). Además se dedica a la chocolatería. Estos dos oficios desde hace 4años.
Comenta que aprendió de manera autodidacta y con poco presupuesto para invertir, sin embargo con los años de trabajo y también gracias a Fondo esperanza ha podido invertir con una mayor cantidad de materiales.
Sus productos, los vende directamente a sus clientes, también gracias al apoyo de su hija quien ofrece sus productos en su lugar de estudio. Además vende los días domingos en un puesto que instala en la feria. 
Con el crédito comprará ingredientes para sus productos de chocolatería y también hilos, tinturas, cuadros, lanas, cajas para sus productos de artesanía.
Sus metas son seguir trabajando en su negocio.
Erika vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 21 y 17 años de edad, su hija estudia en la Universidad la carrera de Educación diferencial.
Sus sueños a nivel personal, son brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad en la educación. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido concretar sus sueños.
Además comenta que su grupo es muy afiatado y han logrado resolver diferencias entre ellos.
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Erika belongs to the “Los Conquistadores” communal bank that belongs to the Puente Alto Commune located in the city of Santiago.  She makes woven, painted and decoupage crafts (this is a manual decorative technique that uses printed paper or fabric that’s glued onto various types of support materials like wood, plaster, ceramic, metal, candles, soap, glass, tiles and carton, among others).  She’s also a chocolatier.  She’s been in both these occupations for four years.

She comments that she was self-taught and had little budget to invest.  However, with years at work and thanks also to Fondo Esperanza she’s been able to invest with larger amounts of materials.

She sells her products directly to her customers and she also gets help from her daughter who sells them where she goes to school.  She also sells on Sundays in a stand she sets up in the street market.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her chocolates and also to buy thread, dyes, frames, wool and boxes for her crafts.  Her goal is to stay in business.

Erika lives with her husband and two children who are 21 and 17 years old; her daughter attends university majoring in Comparative Education.

Her dreams on a personal level are to provide her children with a better quality education.  She’s very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her because it’s helped her make her dreams become a reality.  She also comments that her group is very solid and has managed to resolve differences among them.

Puente Alto is a commune located in north Santiago, Chile’s capital.  It was founded as a small, rural town at the end of the 19th Century but due to its demographic growth is currently one of Chile’s most populous communes with over 600,000 inhabitants.  It is the entry point to one of the sierra's foothill areas in the Metropolitan region known as Cajón de Maipo, a sector with hiking trails, bridal paths and rafting, among other activities; it also has lodging and food services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her chocolate shop and also thread, dyes, frames, wool and boxes for her crafts.

loans.name: Tété Kodjo

texts.fr:
Tété est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 01enfant de 02ans.
Tété travaille comme électricien et revendeur de matériels électriques depuis 1997. Il vend à toutes personnes et s’approvisionne à Lomé. 
Tété a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Il veut épargner. 
Dans les prochaines années, Tété voudrait augmenter le niveau de l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit de scolariser l’enfant et d’augmenter l’activité de la conjointe.
texts.en:
Tété is a 30-year old man. His wife is a vendor. They have a two-year old child. Since 1997, Tété  has been working as an electrician and vendor of electrical supplies. He sells to the general public and stocks up in Lomé.

Tété has requested his first credit from WAGES in order to buy more goods. He would like to make savings. In the years to come, Tété would like to expand his business. He says that, with his revenues, he plans to provide for his child’s education and to bolster his wife’s business.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies

loans.name: Maura Maria

texts.es:
Maura tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 25, 21 y 16 años de edad,  los tres son independientes y viven fuera de su casa, ella vive con su madre  y  hermano en el Barrio El Centro de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Maura estableció su propio negocio de pulpería hace un año donde vende productos de alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, harina, arroz, manteca, etc. También ofrece producto de abarrotería y otros productos como comida de animales, (perro, gato y de pollo). Inicio su propio negocio con la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar y con mucho trabajo y dedicación ha podido salir adelante. Dedicándole todo el día.
Ella solicita un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para invertir en compra productos alimenticios y de abarrotería como (huevos, aceite, harina, arroz, azúcar, maíz, etc. Para poder satisfacer el servicio a los clientes en cuanto a los productos que demandan.
Su meta es seguir trabajando en su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos que le ayuden a poder seguir pagando sus préstamos y poder comprar otra casa.
texts.en:
Maura, 45, is a single mother of three children who are 25, 21 and 16 years of age.  All three are independent and live away from home.  She lives with her mother and brother in Barrio El Centro in San Pedro Sula.

Maura set up her own grocery business a year ago where she sells food items like rice, beans, sugar, flour, rice, lard, etc.  She also sells grocery items like animal feed (dog, cat and chicken).  She started her own business needing to help with household expenses and with much work and dedication has been able to get ahead.  She works all day.

She is asking for a 15,000 lempira loan to buy food and grocery items like eggs, oil, flour, rice, sugar, corn, etc. to meet customer demand with respect to the products they request.  Her goal is to stay in business to earn better income that will help her continue repaying her loans and to be able to buy another house.

loans.use: to buy food and grocery items like eggs, oil, flour, rice, sugar, corn, etc.

location.town: Barrio El Centro. San Pedro Sula

loans.name: Pentalfa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PENTALFA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada.  Está compuesta por once integrantes que cuentan con una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Alejandra. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de juguetes y regalos, venta de productos de belleza, venta de calzados, venta de abarrotes, venta de zapatillas.

La señora Alejandra, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace cuatro años atrás. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta regalos y juguetes, que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su cuñado. El crédito de este ciclo es para aumentar su capital (compra de juguetes y regalos) que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo). Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustó la capacitación en crédito y salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Rosario por razones culturales.
texts.en:
The “Pentalfa” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada Focal Center.  It has eleven members led by a governing board headed by Alejandra.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of occupations.  Among them we have: clothing sales, toy and gift sales, beauty product sales, shoe sales, grocery sales and slipper sales.

Alejandra indicates that she’s been a member of a communal bank for four years.  Currently, she has a business selling gifts and toys that she’s had for years having learned it from her brother-in-law.  The loan this cycle is to increase working capital.  She will buy toys and gifts in street markets to then resell in an ambulatory fashion (no fixed stand).  This way of working allows her to support her family since she’s married and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit training and the health services.  

Due to cultural reasons, Rosario does not appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy toys and gift items.

loans.name: Karen Cecilia

texts.es:
Karen tiene 24 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres la cual se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura y por la amabilidad de sus pobladores; Karen es una joven muy entusiasta gracias a su esfuerzo y el apoyo de sus padres quienes la animaron y la aconsejaron; inicio su negocio de venta de menús y pollo broaster, desde hace un año que Karen; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tienen buena sazon para la presparacion de sus platillos, por ello siempre regresan sus clientes.

Karen está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar implementos para decorar su local como espejos, adornos, sillas, así podrá tener un ambiente más acogedor y cómodo para los clientes y poder estar mejor implementado,lo que le permitirá tener mayor clientela y seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Terminar una carrera”.
texts.en:
Karen, 24, lives at home with her parents in the city of Imperial, a place known for agriculture and friendly people. Karen is a very enthusiastic young woman, thanks to her own hard work and the support of her parents who encourage and advise her. A year ago she started her business selling daily specials and roasted chicken. She thinks that her business is going well because her meals taste good and so her clients keep coming back.

Karen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy things to set up her restaurant like mirrors, decorations and seats, so that she can have a more inviting and comfortable environment for her customers. Having a better set-up will allow her to have more customers and keep working to meet her biggest dream: finishing her degree.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, mirrors, and decorations

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, trabaja como chofer propietario dentro de un sindicato de transportes en la ciudad de La  Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo ya que es la única fuente de trabajo para mantener a su familia.
Julio, es soltero y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus familiares en la zona Tembladerani ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julio works as a taxi driver/owner within one of the city of La Paz’s transportation syndicates.  He needs the loan to service his vehicle since it’s his only source of income to support his family.

Julio is single and has two children that he lives with in a house belonging to relatives located in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.  

This is the first time he works with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Iludis

texts.es: Iludís quiere compartir su novedad con sus financiadores y es que gracias a su apoyo, ha podido hacer ahorros en sus ganancias del negocio, para organizar su casa en el macroproyecto que lidera la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, "Ciudad Bicentenario" de la ciudad de Cartagena. Ella esta muy entusiasmada con su crédito anterior porque compró mercancía variada y materiales para producir las comidas como son granos. Arroz espagueti etc. Ahora se prepara para recibir su segundo credikiva, onceavo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  en esta oportunidad comprará telas, hilos, encajes y todos los insumos que necesita para la producción de cortinas cubre lechos y lencería, porque quiere responde a sus costuras encargadas, en su otro negocio de confecciones, que realiza simultanemanete.
texts.en:
Iludes wishes to share her pleasure with her loans, and the fact that thanks to their help, she has been able to establish enough savings from her business earnings to organize her house in the macro-project sponsored by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, “Ciudad Bicentenario” in the city of Cartagena. She is also very excited about her last loan; she bought varied merchandise and materials to produce meals, including grains, rice, spaghetti, etc. 

Now she is preparing to receive a 2nd “credikiva” (Kiva loan), her 11th loan arranged through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. On this occasion, she will buy cloth, thread, lace, and all necessary supplies to produce curtains, drapes, and linen, so she can fulfill orders in her other micro-business, drapery and curtain making.

loans.use: buy cloth, thread, lace, and all necessary supplies for her 2nd micro-business, making  curtains, drapes, and linens.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luís, trabaja como chofer propietario de un micro bus dentro de un sindicato de transportes en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo ya que es la única fuente con la que cuenta para ayudar a su familia
José Luís, es soltero y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
José Luis works as a driver/owner of a minibus in one of the city of La Paz’s transportation syndicates.  He needs the loan to service his vehicle since it’s his only source of income to support his family.

José Luis is single and has three children he lives with in his parents’ house in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.

This is the third time he’s worked with IMPRO and the second with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay to service his minibus.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 28 years old and married with a four-year-old child. For the past eight years, he has been a tea farmer in Kipsigak and he earns a good income. He has successfully repaid three previous loans from KADET LTD.

Mike is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to purchase fertilizer and to pay laborers. He will use the profits from his loan to expand his tea plantation. Mike hopes to own more tea zones in the area and also to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire laborers

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He sells beans, peas, rice, and maize to earn a living, which he has been doing for three years.  Justus employs one person. 

Justus is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy beans, peas, rice, and maize.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and hopes to expand further in the future.

loans.use: to buy beans, peas, rice, and maize to sell

loans.name: Fanuel Ouma Olingo

texts.en: Fanuel, a 37-year-old married father of three who has been selling fish to earn a living for two years, describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. Fanuel is now requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy fish for resale.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old and married with one child. For the past three years, he has been selling sweaters, blouses, and skirts to earn a living. Stephen has employed one person. He works as a farmer to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Stephen has been able to save his income.

Stephen is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy sweaters, blouses, and skirts to sell. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, blouses, and skirts to sell

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson is 62 years old and is married to Grace, a businesswoman. The couple is blessed with five children. For the past 11 years, Evanson has been a mixed crop farmer and he earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES which he uses to support his family. He has successfully repaid three previous loans with KADET LTD.

Evanson is requesting his fourth KADET LTD loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to educate his children. Evanson's hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup to offer transportation.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, a 40-year-old single mother of one child, has been running a hotel for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

Her previous loans repaid, she is now requesting her third one from KADET LTD. to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her business. With the anticipated profit from her enterprise, Lydia will educate her child. Her dream is to open a nursery school.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her business.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 45 years old and is married with three children: two daughters and a son. She lives in Ijevan. Karine's elder daughter is married and lives separately from parents, her son lives in Russia, and her youngest daughter is a student. Since 1995, Karine and her husband have run a cereal and fodder trading business. They buy products from villagers, stock them in their house, and then sell them to the local food market. Thanks to their business income, Karine and her husband are able to support their family and were able to organize their daughter’s wedding. 

Karine is requesting a 700,000 AMD loan to buy wholesale cereal and fodder to resell. She has been a client of Nor Horizon for many years.

loans.use: to buy cereal and fodder to resesll

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and is married with two children. For the past five years, she has run a grocery store. Mary describes her business environment as good because she faces limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business.

Mary is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy beans, peas, and maize to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, peas, and maize to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 36 years old and is married with two children. For the past five years, he has sold glass to earn a living. To earn extra income, Michael also is a poultry farmer. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income.

Michael is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy glass to sell. In the future, he hopes to expand his business to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy glass to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 51 years old, married, and the mother of five children between the ages of 11 and 25. Her husband is a dairy farmer. For the past eight years, Pauline has owned a store where she sells cereals. She earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Pauline is requesting her first KADET LTD loan of 20,000 KES to purchase two sacks of dry beans for 12,000 KES and four sacks of dry maize 8,000 KES. She will use the profit from her loan to repay what she owes and to pay school fees. Pauline's dream is to prosper in business.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 25 years old and married with three children. For the past three years, she has run a general store to earn a living. Peris describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income.

Peris is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy beans, peas, and shoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, peas, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Rasiya

texts.en:
Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Rasiya obtain her first Kiva loan, which she used as intended and repaid. She was able to increase her herd and increase her sales of milk and meat products. 

Rasiya is now applying for a 120,000 KGS loan to purchase additional cattle. She will use the profit from her loan to buy a car to transport her products.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Dieudonné

texts.fr:
Dieudonné(Jeune homme en chemise blanche avec chapeau) est un homme âgé de 26 ans. Il est marié å une ménagère. Il a 01 enfant âgé d’01an.  
Dieudonné travaille comme revendeur de baffles et amplis depuis 2002. Il vend à toutes personnes dans la zone portuaire.
Dieudonné a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des baffles et des amplis. Il veut ouvrir une boutique pour assurer un avenir radieux à son enfant.
texts.en:
Dieudonné (the young man in the white shirt and hat) is twenty-six years old.  His wife takes care of the home.  They have one child who is a year old. 
Dieudonné has been selling baffles and amplifiers since 2002.  He sells to the general public in the area near the port. 
Dieudonné received his second loan through WAGES in order to buy baffles and amplifiers. He wants to open a shop to help assure a bright future for his child.

loans.use: to buy baffles and amplifiers.

loans.name: Ndolo Peter Makumbi

texts.en:
Ndolo is 58 years old and married with six children. For the past seven years, he has sold spare motor vehicle parts to earn a living. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Ndolo has been able to educate his children.

Ndolo is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy vehicle tires to sell. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy vehicle tires to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He sells charcoal to earn a living, which he has been doing for six years. Daniel employs one person. 

Daniel is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy charcoal to sell. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and hopes to further expand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bubukharia

texts.en: Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Bubukharia obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. She was able to increase her herd and her sales of milk and meat products. Now Bubukharia has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS for purchasing additional cattle. It will allow her to continue to increase her sales of milk and dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Sarapio

texts.en: Sarapio, 31, is a married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has dealt in produce for the last 12 years. He started as a peasant farmer and saved some money. He used his savings to start his current business, which is very profitable. His family dream is to educate his children. His business dream is to have a sustainable food store. Sarapio intends to use the loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Jack

texts.en: Jack, 28, is a married man with seven children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been dealing in produce for the last six years. He started as a peasant farmer growing Irish potatoes. He saved some money, which he used to start his current business. Jack needs the loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias is 40 years old and lives in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop in the same town.

Deogratias is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy sugar for selling at his shop. He dreams of becoming a wholeseller and educating his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 28-year-old married man, living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

His desire is to have a family business. He started as a farmer and later got a shop which he has run for three years. He intends to invest the loan in buying sugar, flour, and general merchandise for his business.

He dreams of turning his retail shop into a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, and general shop merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 45-year-old married man from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a father of five children.

Raed has a grocery store and he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase goods for business purposes.

Raed is looking to expand his store and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase goods for his store

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Yusra is a 35-year-old married woman from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan and a mother of four children. She has a grocery store and is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase a freezer for frozen food.

Yusra is looking to expand her business and open another branch of her store.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for frozen food

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells maize porridge. She lives together with her four children at Nyame Bekyere. 

Ekua has been selling maize porridge for four years now. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale. With the new profit, Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama est une femme âgé(e) de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 04 enfants, dont 03 à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 06ans.  
Ama travaille comme revendeuse de bois de chauffe depuis 2009. Elle vend seule à la maison et achète les marchandises à Lomé. 
Ama a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bois de chauffe. Elle veut avoir une boutique.
Dans les prochaines années, Ama voudrait avoir un dépôt de vente de bois de chauffe. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d'assurer les meilleures conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Ama is a forty-one year old woman.  She is married to a salesman.  They have four children, three of whom attend school.  The oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 6.
Ama has been selling firewood since 2009.  She sells alone from her house and buys her supplies in Lomé. 
Ama received her first loan from WAGES in order to buy firewood.  She wants to open a store. 
In the years to come, Ama would like to have a warehouse for selling her firewood.  She says that with the profits, she could assure the best living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: Lamine est un paysan qui exploite des terres qu'il a hérité de son père.A la fin de l'hivernage durant laquelle il cultive du mil et de l'arachide, il pratique le maraîchage avec des spéculations comme l'oignon, le choux, la salade et le piment...Cette diversité d'activité lui assure des revenus durant les 12 mois de l'année et lui permet de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.Il est marié et père de quatre enfants.afin d'augmenter ses surface de culture, il sollicite un pret de 150000f pour d'acheter des semences de piment et d'oignons.Il ambitionne d'acheter une motopompe pour faciliter l'extraction d'eau de ses puits.
texts.en:
Lamine is a farmer who works with land that he inherited from his father. At the end of the rainy season, during which he grows millet and groundnuts, he switches to market gardening to grow onions, cabbage, lettuce and peppers. Such diversity allows him to generate income throughout all twelve months of the year, which helps him to provide for his family. He is a married father of four children. 

He would like to expand his farmable area, and is now seeking a loan of 150,000F to buy onion and peppers seeds. His goal is to buy a draining pump to assist in extracting water from his wells.

loans.use: to buy onion and pepper seeds.

loans.name: Kareema

texts.en:
Kareema is a 51-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan.

Kareema sells clothes and blankets and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes. She is looking to establish her own shop for her business and purchase a car for the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and blankets for business purposes

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Amena is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of five children. She sells cosmetics and works out of her home.

Amena is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities of cosmetic products for business purposes. An aspiration of Amena is to establish a beauty centre.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products for business purposes

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a sixty-three-year-old woman who is widowed and has five children. She was a teacher who retired from civil service to start up a poultry farm in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

She hopes to grow her business and sustain her family. She also wants to buy land on which to grow crops to add to her sources of income.

loans.use: to buy chickens for rearing.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
Barnabas is 26 years old and single.  He owns a motorcycle that he uses for transport services, which he has been doing for two years.  He earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Barnabas is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD for 20,000 KES, which he will use purchase another motorcycle.  The profits will be used to repay the loan and improve his living standards.  He hopes to own a taxi car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 58-year-old widow. She operates an agro-vet shop and has been in the business for the past six years. She earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES from the business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET LTD  by one of our clients. She will use the loan amount to purchase more fertilizer and seeds for sale. Her dream is to own a hardware shop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto de 41 años vive en el municipio de San Jacinto, en el departamento de Bolívar,  tierra de las hamacas y artesanías en tejido vertical. Su familia está conformada por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 17 años de edad. Su madre en su cultura artesanal forma parte de un grupo en esta población muy bien organizado y esto lo inspiró para vender los productos artesanales. En su negocio trabaja él y su esposa, quien es una artesana titulada por el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “Sena”, organización que controla el estado nacional, para el desarrollo educativo de carreras técnicas y tecnológicas, por eso ella conoce no solo las artesanías de su cultura, sino también las de otras regiones del país. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, porque se prepara con un buen inventario  de hamacas, bolsos y mochilas, así es que comprará en mayor volumen hilazas para hamacas, paquete de hilo fino para bolsos y mochilas y también pitas de madejas. Esto le alcanzara para fabricar 10 hamacas, 50 bolsos y el resto en mochilas. El éxito de la inversión radica en que ya no tendrá que comprar productos donde otros proveedores, porque así ocurre usualmente debido a que su mercado está creciendo,  sino que tendrá un stock de oferta que ofrecer y su experiencia radica en saber venderlos y tener lo que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Humberto, aged 41, lives in the town of San Jacinto, in the department of Bolívar.  This is a land of hammocks and craftsmen who do vertical weaving.  Humberto's family is made up of his wife and four children, who are aged between 12 and 17 years.  His mother makes cultural handicrafts, and is part of a very well organized group in this town, which is what inspired Humberto to sell artisinal products.

He and his wife both work in his business, which is a handicrafts business authorized by the "Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje" ["National Apprenticeship Service"], or "SeNA" for short, organization.  SeNA is a state organization for educational development for technical and technological careers.  For this reason, they do not just sell handicrafts from their own culture, but also those from other regions of the country.

He is currently applying for this Kiva loan because he is preparing a good inventory of hammocks, bags, and backpacks.  The loan will allow him to purchase supplies in greater volume, buying yarn for hammocks, a packet of fine yarn for bags and backpacks, and also skeins of agave fiber.  With this he will be able to make ten hammocks and fifty bags, and use the rest for the backpacks.

The success of this investment lies in the fact that he will not need to purchase products as other suppliers do, which normally happens due to growing sales, but he will have a supply of stock to offer for sale.  His experience resides in knowing how to sell and have in stock what his customers need.

loans.use: to purchase supplies in greater volume, buying yarn for hammocks, a packet of fine yarn for bags and backpacks, and also skeins of agave fiber

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr is 49 years old. He lives in Ijevan. Norayr is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. His daughter is married and lives separately from her parents; his son is a student at the Ijevan branch of Yerevan State University. 

Norayr worked for many years at a public catering association and bread-baking plant. Since 2005, he has been running his own business: confectionery production. He runs his business in his own garage, which he has re-equipped for confectionery production. Norayr’s wife and son help him in the business and thus they fulfill private orders and provide the Tavush region food shops with their production. Thanks to the business, Norayr’s family supports themselves and pays for their son’s education as well.

This is Norayr’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon. Now he is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to buy wholesale flour, sugar, and butter for his production.

loans.use: to buy wholesale flour, sugar, and butter for his confectionery production.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has four children. She lives in Changamwe. She owns a café, which has been running for nine months. Sarah also sells clothes to the residents of her neighborhood. She began both businesses from her savings. 

Sarah wants to diversify her sources of income and has decided to engage in the transport business. She is requesting a loan for 90,000 KES, which she will use to purchase a motorcycle.
 
Sarah’s current business faces the challenge of overall inflation in the country and some clients not paying on time.  She believes that the transport business has a brighter future, which will enable her to buy a van for transport. The additional income from this loan will help Sarah pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna, vive con su familia, y su hija de 34 años, Doña Reyna se dedica a la venta de mercería y pescado seco, ella tiene una larga experiencia en el negocio, ofrece artículos como prendedores, colas, pulseras, tiene el puesto en el mercado, lo atiende a tiempo completo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de prendedores, accesorios, pescado seco, y otros materiales para surtir el negocio, esto incrementara la oportunidad de mejorar las ventas.
La aspiración de doña Reyna es mejorar la vivienda y continuar con la construcción de un pozo artesanal en la vivienda, para mejorar la disponibilidad de agua en la casa, ya que no cuenta con este vital liquido.
texts.en:
Reyna lives with her family and her 34-year-old daughter.  Doña Reyna works selling accessories and dried fish.  She has a great deal of experience in this business, and sells items such as brooches, necklaces and bracelets.  She has a stall in the market where she works full-time.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of brooches, accessories, dried fish, and other materials for stocking up her business.  This will increase her opportunity for improving her sales.

Doña Reyna's goal is to improve her home and continue construction on a well for her home.  This will improve access to water in her house, as right now she doesn't have access to this vital liquid.

loans.use: to purchase brooches, accessories and dried fish.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: AMY est une femme mariée, mère de 5 enfants dont trois filles et deux garçons.Elle exerce un commerce de tissus qu'elle achète dans un pays limitrophe chaque trois mois.Le produits est placé à crédit auprès de ses clients qui paient au bout de deux mois.Avec les revenus tirés de cette activité, elle s'occupe de ses enfants et prend aussi en charge ses propres besoins. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un pret de 200000f pour acheter 5 douzaine de rouleaux de tissus. Elle ambitionne de construire une cantine devant son domicile.
texts.en:
AMY is a married woman and the mother of three girls and two boys. She has a business involving fabrics, which she buys from a bordering nation every three months. The goods are provided on credit to customers who pay at the end of two months. 

With the revenues derived from this business, AMY takes care of her children and also meets her own needs. 

In order to bolster her business capital, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs from UIMCEC to buy five dozen rolls of cloth. Her ambition is to build a stall in front of her home.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen rolls of cloth

loans.name: Silvia Vanessa
